commit_message:
Bump osprofiler minimum requirement to 1.5.0

Ironic cannot even start with 1.4.0. The lower-constraints job works
because it actually uses upper-constraints.

Change-Id: Id34909b9fb159cd2bb06f1512908db4836055c29
Story: #2002900
Task: #22864

'}, {'created': '2018-07-04 22:09:29.000000000', 'message': 'yaml-validator - network_data validate show all errors

Instead of exiting on the first error, set the return

validating the file. By doing this all errors are made
visible with a single run.

Change-Id: I0ecccf3113eeb511b77c447edce0c317f7642f80

commit_message:
yaml-validator - network_data validate show all errors

Instead of exiting on the first error, set the return
value to 1 whenever an error is found and continue
validating the file. By doing this all errors are made
visible with a single run.

Change-Id: I0ecccf3113eeb511b77c447edce0c317f7642f80

commit_message:
FFU: missing ironic tasks

Add database migrations and online data migrations (from Pike on).
Also upgrade packages for both API and conductor (they can be on
different roles).

commit_message:
Use delorean-build-deps.repo for test-package-build

* python-d2t01 is a build deps it comes from build-deps.repo.
  and the same repo is not enabled which was leading to failure
  of tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario000-multinode-oooq-container-upgrades
  jobs. Enabling it fixes the issue.

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561482/ changes the Create
  BuildRequires repo for master

Change-Id: Ia3d2a0b788edfa463398d09149dcc67d81e9925e

(1 comment)

-1 to see if include_roles could be used instead of shell execution.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-13 04:44:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

I'm not a big fan of having a lot of variable for 2 reasons:

* someone has to maintain them in THT
* it's not really tripleo's business

Instead, I suggest that we follow what we have done for some other services like RHSM: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/e64c10b9c13188f37e6f122475fe02280eaa6686/extraconfig/services/rhsm.yaml#L35-L43 with RhsmVars (could be named SkydiveVars) where we pass a dictionnary to Ansible, so you folks can manage vars on your side and we don't have to maintain them here."}, {'account_id': 7141, 'date': '2018-06-13 14:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-06-14 04:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

@Saravanan KR It seems that 'external_deploy_tasks' is executed on the undercloud (hosts: undercloud) so if include_role is used, it won't be executed on the overcloud. Am I missing something ?"}, {'account_id': 7141, 'date': '2018-06-14 08:18:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-06-14 08:55:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> @Saravanan KR It seems that 'external_deploy_tasks' is executed on the undercloud (hosts: undercloud) so if include_role is used, it won't be executed on the overcloud. Am I missing something ?

This is the section that I am referring to use it for include_role, which will be executed on role basis.
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/e64c10b9c13188f37e6f122475fe02280eaa6686/extraconfig/services/ipsec.yaml#L103"}, {'account_id': 7141, 'date': '2018-06-14 14:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

and the deployment is failing for me with:

TASK [skydive_analyzer : Check Skydive agents status] **************************
FAILED - RETRYING: Check Skydive agents status (2 retries left).
FAILED - RETRYING: Check Skydive agents status (1 retries left).

I was able to trace this back to the fact that the analyzer container is not running. If I try to start the skydive-analyzer service it fails with:

The task [skydive_common : Restart service] from roles/skydive_common/tasks/systemd.yml should probably verify the service started successfully before continuing on and failing in a later task.'}, {'account_id': 7141, 'date': '2018-06-22 10:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)

The error is due to the skydive version, it has to be aligned with the ansible version. We just released a new version and submitted a review for kolla. 

https://review.openstack.org/577359

For the skydive status check I submitted a PR

commit_message:
Ceph: Split out ceph provsioners from client chart

This PS splits out the ceph provisioners from the client chart
allowing OSH to be used with external (and multiple) cephs more
simply.

Change-Id: I0c5d516c7a9a10bc8435e2423eb1dc05460d2c92
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Add host prep step for ntp time sync

Docker doesn't like it when the time shifts so if we're building
containers when the ntp time sync actually occurs it can lead to
deployment failures. To prevent this, let's force a ntpdate on the host
during step1 to ensure the hardware time is properly synced before
proceeding.

Change-Id: I812c7da90ae06120707fd8795a41e4fd867f510e
Closes-Bug: #1776869

Mark raw strings as such

This is raising warnings now and will be an error in future versions of
Python 3.

Change-Id: I8827cb36ef2ef85e8f245a2a181fb23ee75bfd16

commit_message:
Use the network-environment file for all overcloud deployments

When deploying the overcloud without network isolation,
the network-environment.yaml file is not included.
This review adds the network-environment.yaml file for all
deployments and uses that file to pass the parameters to
adjust the MTU values for Neutron if the MTU values are
modified on the interfaces.

Depends-On: I10a2a8df25e3110b6584b47dca693c19abeb4930
Change-Id: I928ca8501ad8c2598a8c0057d4f1fe6f1ff1c04c

commit_message:
Add steps to allow downstream to use featuresets

The review builds off https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535458/
and adds tripleo-root clone and settings to be able to use
overcloud deployment templates from
openstack/tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: If1cef78c55041b476103bc028591b72c85cddb6d

[{'created': '2018-07-04 15:17:48.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: add qemu version check when configuring mtu for network

This adds a QEMU check when configuring MTU for ethernet and bridge
interface types. When creating and configuring tap devices, libvirt is
setting MTU but also configures the virtio-net devices to let it
discovers the MTU used. This QEMU 'host_mtu' option is supported by
QEMU version 2.9 and more.

Closes-Bug: 1779626
Change-Id: I55cf259c715ba129fa8479d1e8a0d11ec15aaa43
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e2d7189f4ff7e4a2697256cf3f695327e1d71db2)
"}, {'created': '2018-07-05 10:20:58.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: add qemu version check when configuring mtu for network

This adds a QEMU check when configuring MTU for ethernet and bridge
interface types. When creating and configuring tap devices, libvirt is
setting MTU but also configures the virtio-net devices to let it
discovers the MTU used. This QEMU 'host_mtu' option is supported by
QEMU version 2.9 and more.

Closes-Bug: 1779626
Change-Id: I55cf259c715ba129fa8479d1e8a0d11ec15aaa43
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e2d7189f4ff7e4a2697256cf3f695327e1d71db2)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: add qemu version check when configuring mtu for network

This adds a QEMU check when configuring MTU for ethernet and bridge
interface types. When creating and configuring tap devices, libvirt is
setting MTU but also configures the virtio-net devices to let it
discovers the MTU used. This QEMU 'host_mtu' option is supported by
QEMU version 2.9 and more.

Closes-Bug: 1779626
Change-Id: I55cf259c715ba129fa8479d1e8a0d11ec15aaa43
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e2d7189f4ff7e4a2697256cf3f695327e1d71db2)

commit_message:
Check time order between start_date and end_date

The create lease API doesn't check time order between start_date and
end_date. This allows users to create leases that end before they start.

Change-Id: I90b0559f22cbde9e68727de73958cc778a84d698

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-09 03:34:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix exception in log warning when no cloud config exists

A recent patch added a more descriptive log message, which is great.
Unfortunately, config is not guaranteed in this case to have a cloud
key, so just accessing it with config['cloud'] throws an exception,
which in turn breaks a test in python-openstackclient.

Expand the code a little bit to log the warning differently depending on
whether or not cloud exists and has a value.

Change-Id: I6b058b3c48a6018b1fe8084344f370530d730d25
"}]
commit_message:
Fix exception in log warning when no cloud config exists

A recent patch added a more descriptive log message, which is great.
Unfortunately, config is not guaranteed in this case to have a cloud
key, so just accessing it with config['cloud'] throws an exception,
which in turn breaks a test in python-openstackclient.

Expand the code a little bit to log the warning differently depending on
whether or not cloud exists and has a value.

Change-Id: I6b058b3c48a6018b1fe8084344f370530d730d25

commit_message:
Migrating 2-nodes jobs to the new base configuration

Migrate 2-nodes jobs to the new base configurations This changes make
the multinode jobs use the new base jobs, nodeset and playbooks required
to run the job with the configuration that are closer to zuulv3

Change-Id: Ib9ad8190ace40bd4847d4978c7ee818e7f8395c2

Fix broken README refs in getting started guide

Additionally, rename readme.rst to basic-usage.rst
to not confuse anyone with the document scope.

Closes-Bug: #1778187

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Initial Network configuration views

* Adds ConfigureNetworkStep to CurrentPlan
* Adds NetworkConfiguration modal panel component
  as a wrapped for whole network configuration

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ui-configure-networks
Change-Id: I5eff3fb32a518d2044d0247140047cccc8c443b4

commit_message:
py37: drop use of 'async' as parameter name

Python 3.7 does not allow the use of 'async' as
a parameter name or object attribute; update
occurrences to use a different name.

This is inline with PEP-492, where await and async
are keywords.

Change-Id: I73efcafab1e0832a0ada95f6c12cb6a659dfcf27

commit_message:
Implement fetching of networks

This uses the list_networks workflow.  We also add the necessary
infrastructure for storing network data in the global state.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ui-configure-networks
Change-Id: I274d247d52be896c37b18b4d808b1ae81c35fb5d

commit_message:
replace cmp with total_ordering decorator

The cmp() built-in is no longer available under python 3 and the
__cmp__ method is not used. Remove __cmp__ and __ne__ and add a __lt__
method and use the functools.total_ordering decorator to provide all
of the rich comparison methods for StoreLocations.

Change-Id: Iae1d0c27bd82a42c80fc98f87c9b85edef527c51
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Move unset_flavor_extra_specs to extra specs file

Flavor unset extra spec schema 'unset_flavor_extra_specs'
is present in flavors.py schema file which should be in
flavors_extra_specs.py file.

commit_message:
Rename --endpoint-override to --os-endpoint-override

The ``--endpoint-override`` command line argument has been deprecated.
It is renamed to ``--os-endpoint-override`` to avoid misinterpreting
command line arguments.
It defaults to the ``OS_ENDPOINT_OVERRIDE`` environment variable.

The deprecated ``--bypass-url`` command line argument has been removed.

Change-Id: Ic8a6559cd62d46b837fa9c04b482a46ceba829db
Closes-Bug: #1778536

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: Use Neutron ovs_lib for MPLS OVS

* Use Neutron agent ovs_lib.OVSBridge class to manage MPLS OVS dataplane instead
  of directly running ovs-vsctl and ovs-ofctl shell commands.
* Use OpenFlow groups and buckets to manage load-balancing and add group and
  bucket identifier allocators.
* Extend ovs_lib.OVSBridge add_flow and delete_flows methods to accept list of
  dicts for flow matches and a list of actions parameters.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: Id8f5318746cdee507beb112ba69800a43c7f6f20

Add support for NodeDataLookup for Ceph deployment

Restores compatibility with NodeDataLookup parameter for the
deployment of Ceph via config-download.

Change-Id: I06764271adb73ba73e15e3f7d8d553532db727ef
Closes-Bug: 1778617

commit_message:
PXE Filter dnsmasq: manage macs not in ironic

This changes the dnsmasq PXE filter so that it keeps
macs that are no longer in ironic blacklisted unless
introspection is active or node_not_found_hook is set.

Replacing the previous behaviour that would
exclusively whitelist macs that are no longer in
ironic.

Story: 2001979
Task: 19589
Change-Id: Ib417089116dcbfb25f759708ee3cddcb88ae2111
(cherry picked from commit c4abd6783bd40f39736b62f9fffd95f6af4b8a04)

[{'created': '2018-06-27 11:49:35.000000000', 'message': 'Make profiler.clean() public method

Horizon dashboard has a profiler plugin which calls profiler.init
method at
 openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/profiler/middleware.py
line 64. This creates a profiler and picks a new base_id. The only
way to remove this profiler and stop using this base_id is to call
profiler._clean() method. So this patch changes _clean() to clean()
so it becomes a public method.

Change-Id: Idec7ee240bc7f508aeebcba374a9673652b1cc72
Related-Bug: #1777486
'}]
commit_message:
Make profiler.clean() public method

Horizon dashboard has a profiler plugin which calls profiler.init
method at
 openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/profiler/middleware.py
line 64. This creates a profiler and picks a new base_id. The only
way to remove this profiler and stop using this base_id is to call
profiler._clean() method. So this patch changes _clean() to clean()
so it becomes a public method.

Change-Id: Idec7ee240bc7f508aeebcba374a9673652b1cc72
Related-Bug: #1777486

commit_message:
Clarifications to API & Scenario Tests

Installation of tempest itself and the installation of the
keystone-tempest-plugin is missing from the description.
This change adds them.

Change-Id: I76c4199429b9bffc606928fb32fe87805b7eac24
Signed-off-by: Gergely Csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/579920/2/ : FAILURE in 5h 19m 32s'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-04 15:48:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

As a way forward this seems reasonable, but I feel like this change makes it even more clear about how much we've blurred the lines on what should be happening within a handler module: early on you could look at a handler module and see the small number of black boxes it used to do stuff. Now a lot of that is in the handler module and cognitive load has gone up.

That's okay for now, it's natural there will be an ebb and flow, but it would be good to somehow force ourselves to go back and clean up later."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-07-05 13:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> As a way forward this seems reasonable, but I feel like this change
 > makes it even more clear about how much we've blurred the lines on
 > what should be happening within a handler module: early on you
 > could look at a handler module and see the small number of black
 > boxes it used to do stuff. Now a lot of that is in the handler
 > module and cognitive load has gone up.
 > 
 > That's okay for now, it's natural there will be an ebb and flow,
 > but it would be good to somehow force ourselves to go back and
 > clean up later.

I'd rather have the functions that transform the representation of data -- based on the evolution of the API in microversions -- in the handler file. I really don't like making the object definitions (or those object files) contain any logic that is the result of things like microversions changing the returned representation of something.

While I agree that things used to be neater and cleaner in the handler files, that was before the many microversions that changed request and response payload formats. With the whole "ensure consumer" stuff, would you have preferred that we put all the logic around consumer generation checking (but only if a certain microversion was requested) in the AllocationList.create_all() method?'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:16:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> While I agree that things used to be neater and cleaner in the
 > handler files, that was before the many microversions that changed
 > request and response payload formats. With the whole "ensure
 > consumer" stuff, would you have preferred that we put all the logic
 > around consumer generation checking (but only if a certain
 > microversion was requested) in the AllocationList.create_all()
 > method?

I don't think there are only two options. Python modules are cheap and easy, let's make more. We can have transformers in a third location. But if the choice is limited to being in the handlers or being in objects/resource_provider.py, I'd choose the latter.'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-07-05 14:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-07-06 08:36:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

LGTM!

> We can have transformers in a third location. 

I like this idea. I think objects/resource_provider.py is too deep to put microversion related things (, which is API driven things, IMO).'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-07-09 14:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
move lookup of provider from _new_allocations()

Following patches will be heavily modifying the allocation handler's
_new_allocations() helper function, so this patch pulls part of that
function's purpose -- checking that resource provider UUIDs in the
allocation payload refer to existing resource providers -- out into a
separate helper function, thus reducing the size of the coming patches.

Change-Id: I2875a431726c5248b1522d28542b627d07856a39

commit_message:
Detect skip version upgrades from version earlier than Pike

When performing a skip version upgrade from a release earlier than Pike,
Ironic will crash when check_versions cannot find the 'version' columns
in the database.

This change adds a safety check which detects old database
version missing the 'version' columns. Instead of crashing, it will
inform the user that skip version upgrades are not supported and
that database migrations need to be run for each skipped versions instead.

Story: 2002558
Task: 22122
Change-Id: Ifa100c6fd168fc59b56bba0c41836958b10f2d47

This change add the "nginx.org/proxy-max-temp-file-size" value
to the ingress chart's values file, sets it to "0" to

commit_message:
Add annotation to allow any file size in ingress

This change add the "nginx.org/proxy-max-temp-file-size" value
to the ingress chart's values file, sets it to "0" to
disable temp file caching, and allows serving files of any size.

Change-Id: I536ad98585e0270e033db2bc85d448981b3cfd90

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 15:18:09.000000000', 'message': "Remove incorrect filter on listing subnets

The test case uses 'admin_state_up' as a filter parameter on listing
subnets, but this is an invalid filter since the subnet resource
doesn't have this attribute. This patch removes this filter.

Change-Id: I3f2e6e861adaeef81a1a5819a57b28f5c6281d80
Related-Bug: #1749820
"}]
commit_message:
Remove incorrect filter on listing subnets

The test case uses 'admin_state_up' as a filter parameter on listing
subnets, but this is an invalid filter since the subnet resource
doesn't have this attribute. This patch removes this filter.

Change-Id: I3f2e6e861adaeef81a1a5819a57b28f5c6281d80
Related-Bug: #1749820

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 01:28:03.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7dbb16f6fb0b3e4e3932e0c26569d55208f39ee4
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7dbb16f6fb0b3e4e3932e0c26569d55208f39ee4

commit_message:
Add support for rbd user

Read the rbd_user from the [powervm] section in the conf file.
Use the rbd_user when creating an rbd object. This user id will be
used when trying to connect to the rbd cluster.

Change-Id: I4548eff8afa85e63a8ca40d819298dccffe63e26

commit_message:
Bump pypowervm min 1.1.16

1.1.16 is required for a proposed change [1].

We also add a new lower-constraints.txt and start using that instead
of the one from nova so that we can indicate a more recent pypowervm
minimum. The file is otherwise identical to nova at this point.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573837/

Change-Id: I133370a33afe5e3cababba187459ab28838582eb

[{'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-03-16 15:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-03-16 23:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-03-19 10:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-04-03 09:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Bump'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-04-09 12:19:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-05-08 14:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-06-01 18:40:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The problem (based on my understanding of this config) is that even your project under test will hceckout stable/queens and not the change that you want to be tested.'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-06-04 09:49:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Networking Cisco like several other projects has to trail behind the OpenStack releases because until the projects we are writing plugins for release we do not know what is being to be "stable", and if we don't have a commit to pin too everytime something in the upstream projects changes every single one of our jobs breaks.

However networking-cisco is also branchless so we need to continue to support our older releases off master.

For this reason we do not start developing for the next release on our master branch until neutron has at least released its first beta, but more likely not until the first release candidate.

So until that time we must cap the max version of everything we install in our jobs to the last stable release.

This config change only forces checkout of stable/queens for all the projects that have a stable/queens branch. Networking-cisco is branchless and still checks out master and the change under test regardless of the version of all the other projects. So we end up with master+1 networking-cisco in a stable/queens environment including all the right dependencies. 

We are currently working around this by forcing neutron to stable/queens in our doc-requirements.txt but this isn't ideal when zuul has logic to dynamically do it for us.'}, {'account_id': 6638, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:22:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:33:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)

Networking-cisco is branchless and  doesn't have a stable/queens branch so the zuul logic checkout master for us."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-07-09 15:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superceeded by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581064/'}]

commit_message:
Pin networking-cisco build sphinx docs to stable/queens

Until neutron Rocky beta is released we can not install neutron newer
than queens from pypi so we need to pin this job to stable/queens so the
upper contraints used are the queens upper contraints.

Change-Id: Ib487f72daf767023ce543657a355e9aa72c01515

commit_message:
Correct log path and set handler

The journalbeat process was restarting every playbook run which was not
required. This change moves the restart process to a handler which will
ensure we're not restarting the services when it's not required.

Change-Id: I4c0082d04d99c71c902ae39ee5ad9efc5074889f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add spec for consuming context attributes for policy

A use case came up in Denver during the Queens PTG for external
policy enforcement, which was implemented in Queens. During the Rocky
PTG, it became apparent that external enforcement is hard when
different attributes are sent by different services. This spec
attempts to help address that issue by laying out the necessary
steps for oslo.policy to consume oslo.context objects, resulting
in less duplicate information.

bp policy-enforcement-with-context

Change-Id: Ide634c5ab3454fe8bf9097c747b692e3e86b85c6

commit_message:
define publish-openstack-docs-pti project template

As part of the python3-first goal, we need to update the PTI to
restore the ability to use tox to run the documentation build
commands. This will give us a way to configure each repo to have its
dependencies installed properly and to change the version of python
used in a self-testing patch to the tox.ini file.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580484
Change-Id: If87a3c80bed8dbbe9a93a6350056338e97d98162
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix KeyError if a deprecated key is given

It happens when a deprecated key is given(i.e. os-auth-ver). The service shall
change the reference before calling oslo.config.

Change-Id: I841f027f90e353b7ea5e1ec059286e8fa9b94f49
Closes-Bug: #1774722

@Tony, i can run using below on a centos7 vm, can you try these steps:-

sudo yum -y install libxml2-devel libxslt-devel ruby-devel rsync
sudo yum -y groupinstall "Development Tools"
git clone https://github.com/openstack/puppet-ironic
cd puppet-ironic/
git pull https://git.openstack.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/22/535622/14
mkdir .bundled_gems
export GEM_HOME=`pwd`/.bundled_gems
gem install bundler --no-rdoc --no-ri --verbose
$GEM_HOME/bin/bundle install
$GEM_HOME/bin/bundle exec rake lint
$GEM_HOME/bin/bundle exec rake syntax
$GEM_HOME/bin/bundle exec rake spec



To run acceptance test:-

echo "" | sudo tee -a /etc/ssh/sshd_config
echo "Match address 127.0.0.1" | sudo tee -a /etc/ssh/sshd_config
echo "    PermitRootLogin without-password" | sudo tee -a /etc/ssh/sshd_config
echo "" | sudo tee -a /etc/ssh/sshd_config
echo "Match address ::1" | sudo tee -a /etc/ssh/sshd_config
echo "    PermitRootLogin without-password" | sudo tee -a /etc/ssh/sshd_config
mkdir -p .ssh
ssh-keygen -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa -b 2048 -P ""
sudo mkdir -p /root/.ssh
cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub | sudo tee -a /root/.ssh/authorized_keys
sudo systemctl restart sshd


export BEAKER_set=nodepool-centos7
export BEAKER_debug=yes
$GEM_HOME/bin/bundle exec rspec spec/acceptance'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-05 23:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-05 23:35:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-06 02:26:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

variable.

commit_message:
Add support for configuring ppc64le nodes

The aim of this change to the enable puppet-ironic as used by tripleo to
configure ironic and the tftp services in a way that "just works" with
tripleo.

It adds the ability to tweak ironic's command retry and spacing values
as well as creating architecture specific config and bootfile mappings

Blueprint: multiarch-support
Change-Id: Ia64dd21b55474d402315ba7c05e28604fff3aea8

commit_message:
add _get_usages_from_trees() function

Adds a function to nova/objects/resource_provider.py that returns the
usage records by provider and resource class for all providers in the
requested provider trees (that have matching inventory of the requested
resource classes).

This is a complementary function to the existing
_get_usages_by_provider_and_rc() function that is used to get the same
usage records for non-nested scenarios.

Change-Id: I198579e6b5870b95cf9881aab8ef8f1cad218fa4
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

[{'created': '2018-07-04 16:51:49.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate nova::logging params in ::nova

Deprecates the parameters in ::nova that should be set
in directly in the ::nova class.

We can then remove all the messy pick() calls and backward
compatibility when this has been deprecated for a cycle. [1] [2]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/e211fcfd65f3e1144ca9c29ff7314597e0989abc/manifests/logging.pp#L122-L130

commit_message:
Deprecate nova::logging params in ::nova

Deprecates the parameters in ::nova that should be set
directly in the ::nova::logging class.

We can then remove all the messy pick() calls and backward
compatibility when this has been deprecated for a cycle. [1] [2]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/e211fcfd65f3e1144ca9c29ff7314597e0989abc/manifests/logging.pp#L122-L130
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-nova/blob/master/manifests/init.pp#L531

Change-Id: I0fb2def264bd72101612291708df26f143183c8a

This should have a depends-on with the patch that adds a microversion that adds support for this request format on the placement side (i.e. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517757)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-11-06 15:59:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

So this patch is (on purpose) not actually *using* the new method in the API call.  I'll eventually be putting a new patch on top to do that, and that one will either have the Depends-On you suggest, or (if this has merged at that point) actually be based on the patch you reference."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-11-06 16:57:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

My usual concern with doing things like that is that inevitably we end up merging code that ostensibly was supposed to interface with an API that we planned to look one way but by the time we merge that thing, looked a different way, and we have code land that essentially is orphan code never to be used.

That's why I prefer to land the patch that actually adds the server side of the spec before the client."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-11-06 17:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

No clear disagreement, just a rathole on a defaulted extra spec value.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-05-18 15:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-18 15:15:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I suppose there's actually awkwardness either way... if we put a default group_policy, then an error won't happen when trying to launch a flavor that the admin either forgot to add the group_policy extra spec to or hadn't yet gotten around to adding the group_policy extra spec to.

On the other hand, having a default group_policy might introduce unexpected behaviour for that same admin.

At the end of the day, it's probably just a documentation issue I guess, as has been mentioned by Gibi and others."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-18 15:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-18 15:23:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

> On the other hand, having a default group_policy might introduce unexpected behaviour for that same admin.

Yup, the summary of the discussion in the spec, from my recollection, is arguments can be made either way for the default policy, so we shouldn't assume a default and just make it explicit in the API - it's required and you need to tell us what you want. I remember we took the same path with the 2.37 microversion for get me a network and the 'networks' request in the server request body - you have to tell us exactly what you want."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-18 17:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

commit_message:
Granular requests to get_allocation_candidates

nova.scheduler.utils.ResourceRequest now has a to_querystring method
that produces a querystring in the format expected by the GET
/allocation_candidates API.  The report client now uses this method to
invoke said API.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-04 13:06:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix openstack CLI calls environment when using venv

Without this fix the calls to openstack CLI will
return code 2 + error 'No such file or directories'
because the virtual env has not been propagated as

commit_message:
Fix openstack CLI calls environment when using venv

Without this fix the calls to openstack CLI will
return code 2 + error 'No such file or directories'
because the virtual env has not been propagated as
part of the execution PATH

Furthermore this is quite disturbing due to the fact
that some of the failing tasks are marked as
ignore_errors: true.

Change-Id: Iadd3ec14bfd4765488937ea7aa64d296fb129988

commit_message:
Fix uwsgi configuration when using venv

Without this fix, the following step will fail
bifrost-ironic-install : Ensure service project is present
and you will have errors in uwsgi like

...: Traceback (most recent call last):
...:   File "/var/www/keystone/public", line 6, in <module>
...:     from keystone.server.wsgi import initialize_public_application
...: ImportError: No module named keystone.server.wsgi

(extracted from journalctl -u uwsgi output)

Change-Id: If238ceb3d6309e491235aa63e1adccd7d0606be3

commit_message:
remove restrictions on repos allowed to use publish-openstack-tox-docs

We want to use publish-openstack-tox-docs as part of the PTI for
building documentation for all projects, so we need to allow all
projects to use it.

Change-Id: I718397cd51d43220e5226e8f88b7db699ea01bdd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove typo in the documentation

While YAML allow 4 spaces to define a dict, being consistent
with two spaces provides clarity for the deployer.

subject: Change ceph caps to profile rbd
messages: [{'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-07-03 21:49:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-07-09 08:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-09 12:46:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 21:49:41.000000000', 'message': 'Change ceph caps to profile rbd

Based on the documentation [1] and this
bug [2] we should set caps for ceph keys
that use RBD to use the profile.

As we can see in the bug [2] setting it to wrong
can have cause very bad issues, this should direct
as a guideline since we will not hit this in CI.

[1] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/luminous/rbd/rbd-openstack/#setup-ceph-client-authentication
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1773449

Change-Id: I3767645807279afac77c1c367a70af6f0f9f4084
(cherry picked from commit 70cb017808e2f783bcb7fdeb782ef5553036e6eb)
'}]
commit_message:
Change ceph caps to profile rbd

Based on the documentation [1] and this
bug [2] we should set caps for ceph keys
that use RBD to use the profile.

As we can see in the bug [2] setting it to wrong
can have cause very bad issues, this should direct
as a guideline since we will not hit this in CI.

[1] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/luminous/rbd/rbd-openstack/#setup-ceph-client-authentication
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1773449

Change-Id: I3767645807279afac77c1c367a70af6f0f9f4084
(cherry picked from commit 70cb017808e2f783bcb7fdeb782ef5553036e6eb)

commit_message:
Add compute microversion 2.61 schema in flavors_client

Compute microversion 2.61 adds 'extra_specs' in flavor APIs response
This commit fill the schema gap for that.

Change-Id: Id1f1e51fbae1cc3d0c9efdcd9009f384745915d6

commit_message:
Fix dns servers for standalone

You need to specify dns servers or it doesn't work. Also we need to
properly configure the dns name for the hosts file generation

Change-Id: I79148f4e09979e3c95f1be0c934e2ec280cdbc75

commit_message:
Moving more utils to ProviderUsageBaseTestCase

The I55edd2c6e4c752dbe675b6d51d71a047bf49597a refactor created a base class
for test cases that are checking allocations. This patch moves additional util
functions from the ServerMovingTest class to the base. The subsequent patch
covering soft delete cases needs these utils for non server moving tests.

Also the utils are made more generic to handle arbitrary number of compute
services. For this to work the setUp of the existing test classes needed
a small enhancement too.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I89e2682c9210901cf1992dac2f9068b51f0373cd in Pike.

Change-Id: I8430d39b8e8147731080e76f14a1a2b809c9863c
(cherry picked from commit 6c49c2c8fc4b04138e09c7b2feb5e996d9ef3d8c)

commit_message:
Fix Non-unique network names in Servers IPs API response

Original spec change mixed two distinct API paths.
This change fixes the spec to address each path.
As a result, responses shall be fixed for server API paths:

 - GET /servers/detail
 - GET /servers/{server_id}
 - GET /servers/{server_id}/ips
 - PUT /servers/{server_id}
 - POST /servers/{server_id}/action (rebuild)

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint servers-ips-non-unique-network-names

Partial-Bug: #1708316
Change-Id: I6a0ca905996a50a6953e3932cf2636804d53a407
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <maciej@kucia.net>

commit_message:
Add python3 to bindep

We recently switched to using python3, so let's add the files to
bindep.txt as well so that the packages get installed if needed.

Note this is a nop in OpenStack CI since python3 is available already.
But this is important to document dependencies.

Change-Id: Ic6c1c9adcec938c0db4f207d1d8e523e96ffe740

[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:29.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie8f95d33a62e1c5c1437f24c6d02c6a8167e83e0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-06 21:21:35.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

Change-Id: Ie8f95d33a62e1c5c1437f24c6d02c6a8167e83e0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie8f95d33a62e1c5c1437f24c6d02c6a8167e83e0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Currently the contrail vrouter interface member interface can

messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-06-11 16:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-11 18:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

+2 if there were a test for the versionnegotiation Controller, since apparently this was broken in Python 3 and nobody noticed. (And the same for unauthenticated versionnegotiation after I097bf70431a999a0f6aa56079ffb5743b50d4d7f, as you mentioned on IRC.)'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-06-12 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

I've noticed something more worrisome - when deployed under Apache_vhost, the API url returned by version document is wrong since it swallows vhost:

on fresh devstack:
$ openstack catalog show orchestration
...
public: http://192.168.100.11/heat-api/v1/23d3e577cfd34fcca8b874a56df77706
...

$ curl http://192.168.100.11/heat-api
{"versions": [{"links": [{"href": "http://192.168.100.11/v1/", "rel": "self"}], "status": "CURRENT", "id": "v1.0"}]}

notice how the 'heat-api' vhost is swallowed in the returned href

Seems like need to file a proper Story for all this'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-06-12 11:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-12 23:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Fix versions Controller for Py3

the webob's Response.body in fact accepts only bytes,
so under Python3 an attempt to assign a text value to webob's response.body
produces the following exception:

TypeError: You cannot set Response.body to a text object (use
Response.text)

Change-Id: I6352ec0662441dab039f15b35c8383e6d7d3dc78
Story: 2002531
Task: 22076

commit_message:
Merge server create for security group extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the server_create for security group extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-rocky
Note- unit tests will be moved to test_serversV21 when we will merge
the extended response for security group.

Change-Id: I447947e23451d3898a5eee0e25facc3d9ae8c01e

commit_message:
Merge server create for user data extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the server_create for user data extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-rocky

Change-Id: I138b1ec4d14275b45922f6542e5f942d4615b916

commit_message:
Update keystone-paste.ini to drop v2

We no longer support Identity v2 API, so we can also drop the
corresponding entries from keystone-paste.ini. Not sure why keystone
hasn't done the same thing upstream yet, it is done though in devstack
[0].

[0] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/lib/keystone#n217

Change-Id: Iea57b6b5a85221f8a401c04680c1d0f0674edf33

commit_message:
Autogenerate configuration documentation

This change aims to generate documentation for the configuration
options automatically. This requires a small fix to one of the
configuration option's help strings, which was incorrectly formatted as
a tuple.

Change-Id: I0878ef930b58e16b46cf437300b93e40ef4141d8
Signed-off-by: Gergely Csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: remove the global lower-constraints.txt file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 17499, 'name': 'Filippo Inzaghi', 'email': 'zhao.daqing@99cloud.net', 'username': 'qingszhao'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26297, 'name': 'pippo', 'email': '1211099771@qq.com', 'username': 'huang.zhiping'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-29 19:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-06-30 21:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-02 15:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-02 18:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-07-04 09:33:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm still undecided on this change. on the pro side I see the duplicated effort and I think generating the file is a much nicer approach, on the down side I'm missing a global coinstallability check (I never finished the implementation of that though)."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-04 23:48:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

> I'm still undecided on this change. on the pro side I see the
 > duplicated effort and I think generating the file is a much nicer
 > approach, on the down side I'm missing a global coinstallability
 > check (I never finished the implementation of that though).

It wouldn't be too terrible to create a new job that lists certain projects (probably not all but it could) as required-projects (or whatever that's called in zuul).  Then build the lower-constraints.txt from the combination of all those projects and then run devstack from there.

The run time isn't terrible:

 [tony@thor requirements]$ time .tox/venv/bin/build-lower-constraints ../*/lower-constraints.txt > tjmaxx.txt
 
 real	0m8.362s
 user	0m8.254s
 sys	0m0.054s
 [tony@thor requirements]$ time .tox/venv/bin/build-lower-constraints ../../*/*/lower-constraints.txt > tjmaxx.txt
 
 real	0m8.552s
 user	0m8.448s
 sys	0m0.058s"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-05 13:38:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-05 13:40:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > I'm still undecided on this change. on the pro side I see the
 > > duplicated effort and I think generating the file is a much nicer
 > > approach, on the down side I'm missing a global coinstallability
 > > check (I never finished the implementation of that though).
 > 
 > It wouldn't be too terrible to create a new job that lists certain
 > projects (probably not all but it could) as required-projects (or
 > whatever that's called in zuul).  Then build the lower-constraints.txt
 > from the combination of all those projects and then run devstack
 > from there.
 > 
 > The run time isn't terrible:
 > 
 > [tony@thor requirements]$ time .tox/venv/bin/build-lower-constraints
 > ../*/lower-constraints.txt > tjmaxx.txt
 > 
 > real	0m8.362s
 > user	0m8.254s
 > sys	0m0.054s
 > [tony@thor requirements]$ time .tox/venv/bin/build-lower-constraints
 > ../../*/*/lower-constraints.txt > tjmaxx.txt
 > 
 > real	0m8.552s
 > user	0m8.448s
 > sys	0m0.058s

Most of the community is not interested in a lower bounds co-installable set of projects, so we should not force them to maintain a list or gate on the settings in projects working across repos. The idea behind the new tool is to allow a deployer or distro to build their own list and run their own tests."}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-07-05 16:46:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- neutron-grenade: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1763070

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-07-05 17:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck 1763070'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-05 21:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-05 21:51:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I'm okay with this.  I'd like Dirk to approve this."}, {'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2018-07-08 00:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-07-08 00:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-07-09 08:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Okay, thanks Doug for the patience with me.'}]

commit_message:
remove the global lower-constraints.txt file

Rely on our ability to compute a good lower constraints set for
multiple projects using the build-lower-constraints command instead of
maintaining a single list in this repository.

Change-Id: I0a4be42efdbfd73228d043c1aa21feb7829650f3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add --cleanup argument for image uploads

This exposes the new cleanup behavior from change
Id844aa2fa5ee20ad264b2fada75fa6cffdc1e307. When this lands it can be
used in CI to make undercloud deploys faster with --cleanup partial.

Change-Id: Id75d5288c308e58143662703da3dddbdbcb0cdd9
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Add subnet host_routes to output of OS::TripleO::*::Ports::Port

Adds the host_routes on the neutron ports subnet to the output
of the Tripleo Ports template. This will allow use of get_attr
in the role to pass routes for a subnet to NetworkConfig.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I46896153ea59ae0a6a8dff0208de2b0d168927ae

commit_message:
Parametrize ansible transport setting

As we want to share the ansible.cfg generation with
tripleo undercloud/standalone deployments, allow to
use custom transports, like local. Make
ansible ssh_private_key optional as no SSH keys might
be expected for some of the transport cases (like local).

Change-Id: Ie7dd9039ee74aac046679e831ffda143257e3825
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix connection plugin to work with Ansible 2.6.0

The connection plugin needs to follow the upstream connection/ssh
plugin's docstring, otherwise this causes failures for undefined options
sftp_executable and scp_executable. This PR adds those docstrings to
mirror upstream.

This follows on from a patch in upstream ansible:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/36648/files

Change-Id: Ia2a2f2238bb60710c7efe76e2cd9f86493833a2d

commit_message:
Set configure_qemu to true to get qemu port range applied

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561784 we change the default
migration port range to '61152-61215'.
nova::migration::qemu::configure_qemu needs to be set to true that
the config gets applied via puppet-nova.

Change-Id: Iad4b392c9fe7426f2ce10a02fadd8b1aeee34ef6
Closes-bug: 1779820
Depends-On: Idadfc7b3507977f1385e846a48a734ed0e5f0a32
(cherry picked from commit 547552fc7b6730f7d0670c5b0d76f63e5372f8c7)
(cherry picked from commit 322747fa6e62fd74bc6e40515b9563d8e62f4654)

@Rabi, do I need a change at here https://github.com/openstack/heat-agents/blob/master/heat-config/os-apply-config/etc/os-collect-config.conf#L37 and https://github.com/openstack/heat-agents/blob/master/heat-config/os-apply-config/etc/os-collect-config.conf#L47 ? LGTM.

I think it's likely that you will also need an additional change in the os-collect-config conf, and probably also in Heat in the vicinity of http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat/tree/heat/engine/resources/server_base.py#n64 to make sure the initial user_data passed to Nova contains the region that the server needs to call back to Heat to see the software deployments as they're created. (This change then ensures using the right region to signal back once the deployments are complete.)"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-06 04:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> @Rabi, do I need a change

Yes, I think that needs to be changed along what Zane mentioned here and os-collect-config change I mentioned in the other patch.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-07-07 20:21:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-07-09 03:40:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-07-09 09:52:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:05:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Cherry Picked

[{'created': '2018-07-02 19:02:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add region_name for heat-config-notify

Now there is no region name when heat-config-notify try to get the
heat endpoint or zaqar endpoint. As a result, it could be a wrong
one returned from Keystone because there is no region name specified.
This patch fixes it.

Please refer Iec6f3606c9fdf8474f393b0990356f34d38bcf75 for the change
in Heat.

commit_message:
Add region_name for heat-config-notify

Now there is no region name when heat-config-notify try to get the
heat endpoint or zaqar endpoint. As a result, it could be a wrong
one returned from Keystone because there is no region name specified.
This patch fixes it.

Please refer Iec6f3606c9fdf8474f393b0990356f34d38bcf75 for the change
in Heat.

Please refer I88182a9a9af74e9760b2ec9b500971f06293f0b8 for the change
in occ.

Task: 22720
Story: 2002781

Change-Id: I8e0518fa61e237ec055834dd4bebe0fc87cd6627

[{'account_id': 15880, 'date': '2016-01-10 11:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2016-01-10 11:50:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

[{'created': '2018-07-06 11:16:18.000000000', 'message': "Drop dmsetup from rootwrap

The 'dmsetup' command is not being used anywhere so remove it
from the volume.filters.

Change-Id: I0619713c5159cf8988804f1949346e238f09445f
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Drop dmsetup from rootwrap

The 'dmsetup' command is not being used anywhere so remove it
from the volume.filters.

Change-Id: I0619713c5159cf8988804f1949346e238f09445f
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Ie914d57bd39820d01ccdcf756f1fced4d1ca89b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 10:55:57.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Change-Id: Ic346e642f52f064b002f5a2facead2fca5a7a03a
"}, {'created': '2018-07-02 13:09:01.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Change-Id: Ic346e642f52f064b002f5a2facead2fca5a7a03a

we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a

needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580156
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580601
Change-Id: Ic346e642f52f064b002f5a2facead2fca5a7a03a

subject: Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

"}, {'created': '2018-05-31 13:36:37.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Ansible 2.5 is a hard dependency for this patch due to the dynamic setting
of the ansible_python_interpreter, which in 2.4 is literally interpreted,
but in 2.5 thanks to [1] is now templated. See [2] for more details.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/33698
[2] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/18665
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568139

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Ansible 2.5 is a hard dependency for this patch due to the dynamic setting
of the ansible_python_interpreter, which in 2.4 is literally interpreted,
but in 2.5 thanks to [1] is now templated. See [2] for more details.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/33698
[2] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/18665

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. As there are no required packages left, the task to install them is
also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Ansible 2.5 is a hard dependency for this patch due to the dynamic setting
of the ansible_python_interpreter, which in 2.4 is literally interpreted,
but in 2.5 thanks to [1] is now templated. See [2] for more details.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/33698
[2] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/18665

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580156
Change-Id: Ic3c0bb31c12a83fe8fe475091e97e5d5537fab6f

commit_message:
ODL feature fetch: parse configs

ODL supports a configuration string for each feature.
This string is now extracted from the json and made
available in the odl_features API.

Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I274f9ac337be5acd1f56d173fcd7584c82dd3b24

subject: Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 18:35:52.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Change-Id: I261a49e374d34d00d0be1863da701b7a13ceb3c6

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580156
Change-Id: I261a49e374d34d00d0be1863da701b7a13ceb3c6

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580156
Change-Id: I261a49e374d34d00d0be1863da701b7a13ceb3c6

[{'created': '2018-07-09 08:45:37.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I308e9df65531f000b49ea22da2f5544047770108
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I308e9df65531f000b49ea22da2f5544047770108

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

commit_message:
Running the node-exporter on all nodes.

Using a node selector can not run the node-exporter on the master node.
So, This PS changes the scheduling to use taint/toleration instead of
the node selector.

Change-Id: I54ee8c53b4ca3d4118953b811708a4eaab12fcdb

http://paste.openstack.org/show/724230/'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-06-26 10:01:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Does this patch fixes multimaster for you?

For me it doesn't 9 (or more) out of 10 times, usually with coredns setup or
deploying the dashboard. Less frequently with a timeout in wc-notify.

it was failing to deploy resources because etcd wasn't ready and the api didn't have time to write all the resources in the etcd db, for example, what is a clusterRole? Since it wasn't in the db, when we asked the api to create some rules for coredns, the server replied, I don't know these resources. This error happens fast because SoftwareDeployments break when a script exits with non zero code, so heat tell us about immediately.

The other error is a timeout from wc-notify. wc-notify is a systemd unit that depends on etcd and docker and in the  unit there is a while loop that wait for the api. Because we bootstrap an etcd cluster, some server might restart or not report ready, then the wc-notify will think that a dependency is not satisfied."}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2018-06-26 10:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-26 11:46:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Jim, did you get a chance to test this patch?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-26 11:47:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

yeah this works great. just tested it. +2 =)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-28 21:28:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Sync service account keys for multi masters

Multi master deployments for k8s driver use different service account
keys for each api/controller manager server which leads to 401 errors
for service accounts. This patch will create a signed cert and private
key for k8s service account keys explicitly, dedicatedly for the k8s
cluster to avoid the inconsistent keys issue.

Task:  21653
Story: 1766546

Change-Id: I61547405f866d3c5a84da63de66724b55af1066a

subject: Increase vault init token use limit
messages: [{'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-07-04 08:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-07-09 06:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1\n\nI just tried a deploy and 4 uses was not enough'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-07-09 08:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-07-09 08:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-04 08:56:29.000000000', 'message': 'Increase vault init token use limit

The documentation for vault suggests creating a token from the
root token specifically for the vault authorisation action.
To lock the token down the number of times the token can be used is
set. At the moment it is set too low as the charm tries to use it
multiple times. This update increases the limit to allow the action
to complete.

Change-Id: I07c233ccadd52ec7fe2fff6276e56cd88c48acf1
Closes-Bug: #1779875
'}, {'created': '2018-07-09 08:04:43.000000000', 'message': 'Increase vault init token use limit

The documentation for vault suggests creating a token from the
root token specifically for the vault authorisation action.
To lock the token down the number of times the token can be used is
set. The charm action uses the token multiple times so the action
fails. Since the token is created with a relatively short ttl it
seems reasonable to remove the usage limit entirely.

Feedback from users has shown that when following the documentation
the need to unseal each vault unit individually was missed so this
instruction is now next to the unseal explanation as well as being
reiterated in the HA section.

When deploying an HA configuration etcd must support etcd3, this
requirement was lacking in the instructions so it has been added.

Change-Id: I07c233ccadd52ec7fe2fff6276e56cd88c48acf1
Closes-Bug: #1779875
'}]
commit_message:
Increase vault init token use limit

The documentation for vault suggests creating a token from the
root token specifically for the vault authorisation action.
To lock the token down the number of times the token can be used is
set. The charm action uses the token multiple times so the action
fails. Since the token is created with a relatively short ttl it
seems reasonable to remove the usage limit entirely.

Feedback from users has shown that when following the documentation
the need to unseal each vault unit individually was missed so this
instruction is now next to the unseal explanation as well as being
reiterated in the HA section.

When deploying an HA configuration etcd must support etcd3, this
requirement was lacking in the instructions so it has been added.

Change-Id: I07c233ccadd52ec7fe2fff6276e56cd88c48acf1
Closes-Bug: #1779875

commit_message:
Fix bootstrap_host_exec check for manila_share

The hiera check for bootstrap node was using 'manila-share'
for service name, which returns nil.  Changing the service
name to 'manila_share', the hiera lookup for
'manila_share_short_bootstrap_node_name' succeeds.

Change-Id: Id3c001f8f0ee9dc156f22a027f66516d6812f51a
(cherry picked from commit 25f93efd8c3ce7335651b26818e30e5b6546cb42)

[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:45:35.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id03d28442b998624153e048ad9a621f31dbdb7d2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id03d28442b998624153e048ad9a621f31dbdb7d2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Ensure remote_user and become are consistently implemented

It makes no sense to use become when you're connecting to a
host via the root remote_user. As such, we remove all uses of
'become: true' from the test plays with the exception of the
'test-prepare-keys.yml' playbook which uses a local connection
rather than a remote one and it therefore needs to use become.

We also transition all plays to use 'remote_user' which is the
correct parameter to replace 'user' (since ansible 1.4).

Finally, we switch the horizon nova service setup to its own
playbook using a local connection and the upstream keystone
modules.

Change-Id: I20517c22f07b1bb811a51d8c63741604360fe7f8

commit_message:
Fix unbound local when saving an unchanged RequestSpec

RequestSpec._get_update_primitives() tried to return the unitialized
db_updates field when the object has no changes. This patch initalizes
that local to None and handles that None in create() and save() where
the RequestSpec._get_update_primitives() is called.

Change-Id: Iad256079945bf8b5745ebdcc393c55115dbcab75
Closes-Bug: #1775863
(cherry picked from commit 08fb09e878dcaedbb446e18502a6172fa4d43121)

I would like to discuss the semantics of the OS::Blazar::Lease object and understand how it interacts with OS::Nova::Server objects.

If an OS::Nova::Server "depends_on" an OS::Blazar::Lease, will the instance be launched once the lease is created? I would be handy to be able to launch the instance only when the lease has started.

Can the reservations field inside OS::Blazar::Lease be accessed easily and used as a scheduler_hints for OS::Nova::Server?'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-01 16:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(5 comments)

> If an OS::Nova::Server "depends_on" an OS::Blazar::Lease, will the instance be launched once the lease is created? I would be handy to be able to launch the instance only when the lease has started.

Yes.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-02-02 02:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

>Can the reservations field inside OS::Blazar::Lease be accessed easily and used as a scheduler_hints for OS::Nova::Server?
Yes, you can access it.
host reservation case,
scheduler_hints: {reservation: { get_attr: [lease01, reservations, 0, id] }}

instance reservation case,
flavor: { get_attr: [lease01, reservations, 0, flavor_id] }'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-02-02 06:47:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-02-02 08:04:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Thanks for the update.  Now that I'm thinking about it, Heat would have its own way that follows either API or CLI definitions. IMHO, it's good to follow the standard.  If it's nothing, I prefer to follow API definitions."}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-04-18 02:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-04-19 17:50:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1
