Not like it matters, but update the README.rst file [1] to show we integrated with Blazer will be nicer:)

[1] https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/README.rst'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-04-19 17:52:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-04-20 08:02:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

Sorry slow response. Blazar team discussed it in team meeting. We agreed that Blazar plugin is better to follow Heat standards having a default value or not.  If there is no standard there, having a default value in resource is user friendly.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-04-23 08:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-04-24 03:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-04-24 03:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

Some of the requirements are not in sync, hence the requirements-check job is failing. We should land https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560577/ before making any requirement changes.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-04-24 06:44:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-04-25 04:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-04-25 04:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-04-25 06:43:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

Hi Masahito, thanks for your comment.  I discussed with Heat team & got opinion we should not implement the default value for start_date and end_date.  We are not sure it is useful that datetime info from heat-engine will be expected one or not.  Also perhaps having the default values in Heat has possibility bothering Blazar client and API to provide their default value in near future.  Hopefully we will be on same page.  Thank you very much.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-04-25 11:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the discussion. I agree the possibility for the default value mismatching between Heat resource and Blazar API.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-06-06 02:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-06-07 06:35:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-06-12 05:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Code-Review-1

(14 comments)

some work needs to be achieved, we should try to land this in Rocky cycle.

Also we should also implement check_XXX_complete for each handle_XXX function in resources so we can make sure action actually completed'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-06-12 06:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Published edit on patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-06-12 06:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-06-12 06:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

> Masahito Muroi
Hi, does Blazar have any constraint for min, max, amount, vcpus, memory_mb, disk_gb in reservation ? like minimum 0 or 1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-06-12 06:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

I think it will be better to at least leave some descriptions in resources to demonstrate why we think to leave headle_update is a better idea:)'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-06-12 09:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-06-13 04:51:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

> Hi, does Blazar have any constraint for min, max, amount, vcpus, memory_mb, disk_gb in reservation ? like minimum 0 or 1

The values are Integer and >=0.  And if min is greater than max Blazar API returns an error.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-06-14 01:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-06-14 01:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

>Masahito Murai
Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-06-28 08:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-06-29 03:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)

You can separate to three patch, create client, create host resource, and create lease resource, might help for people to review this'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-07-06 07:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 25221, 'date': '2018-07-09 07:46:02.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

According to Rico's advice, now this patch is split out to 3 patches.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580895/

Lease resource
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580943/"}]

commit_message:
Add Blazar support to Heat

Add OS::Blazar::Lease, OS::Blazar::Host and the relevant modules to
support Blazar which is a resource reservation services in OpenStack.
As a result of discussion with Blazar team, we dont't support stack
update for OS::Blazar::Host & OS::Blazar::Lease because the current host
and lease api scheme is not suitable for Heat's spec.  According to
Blazar's update in Rocky cycle, Heat will support the update stack
scenarios for Blazar.

Change-Id: I1392919540a6bdd67ce7078e3a1206ecdb9854e1
Implements: blueprint heat-plugin-blazar
Task: 19754
Story: 2002085

subject: Separate kubelet support packages
messages:
[{'account_id': 26598, 'date': '2018-06-21 15:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-06-21 20:14:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

would it be possible to have a common, ubuntu & debian requirements section to avoid the duplication?'}, {'account_id': 26598, 'date': '2018-06-22 00:20:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> would it be possible to have a common, ubuntu & debian requirements
 > section to avoid the duplication?

Hi Chris

Are you prefer this one?

-    - libxtables11
     - socat
 
+- name: ubuntu | installing kubelet support packages
+  when: ansible_distribution == 'Debian'
+  apt:
+    name: "{{item}}"
+    state: installed
+  with_items:
+    - libxtables12
+
+- name: ubuntu | installing kubelet support packages
+  when: ansible_distribution == 'Ubuntu'
+  apt:
+    name: "{{item}}"
+    state: installed
+  with_items:
+    - libxtables11
+

The code number almost same.'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-06-22 01:38:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

i personally think that's better because you can see what's common vs what's different

i'm happy to defer to others though"}, {'account_id': 26598, 'date': '2018-06-22 03:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21691, 'date': '2018-06-25 23:35:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-06-26 00:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-06-26 00:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-07-09 02:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-07-09 06:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-07-09 06:26:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}]

commit_message:
Separate kubelet support packages

Debian has no libxtables11 package
Libxtables11 only for ubuntu while libxtables12 for debian

Change-Id: I258bea9869d2126295d080ef9d00800b83161cc3

Since this change is likely to be backported, I think we should fix them'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-25 15:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-25 15:04:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow-1

(3 comments)

will update reno as well.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-25 15:33:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-25 15:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-06-05 15:42:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-06-12 19:24:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)

I'm unsure about this change and feel like this could be problematic. We should likely talk through it."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-06-13 16:52:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-06-14 23:57:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I'm unsure about this change and feel like this could be
 > problematic. We should likely talk through it.

The results of some manual testing below.

=================
Current behaviour
=================

  3 Nodes enrolled, no active introspection.
  ------------------------------------------
  
    [stack@leafs ~]$ cat /var/lib/ironic-inspector/dhcp-hostsdir/*
    52:54:00:04:98:db,ignore
    52:54:00:0a:e7:cc,ignore
    52:54:00:76:4f:56,ignore
    *:*:*:*:*:*,ignore
    
    
  Delete a node
  -------------
    
    [stack@leafs ~]$ openstack baremetal node delete os-ctl0
    Deleted node os-ctl0
    [stack@leafs ~]$ cat /var/lib/ironic-inspector/dhcp-hostsdir/*
    52:54:00:04:98:db,ignore
    52:54:00:0a:e7:cc,ignore
    52:54:00:76:4f:56
    *:*:*:*:*:*,ignore
    
    
     Result:
      * Node 4f:56 will now always boot introspection.
      * Any node that was never enrolled will be filtered.

  Conclusion
  ----------

  This is not desiered, if discovery is not enabled the deleted node should be
  ignored the same as any node that was never enrolled.
 


===============
Whit this patch
===============
    
  3 Nodes enrolled, no active introspection.
  ------------------------------------------

    [stack@leafs ~]$ cat /var/lib/ironic-inspector/dhcp-hostsdir/*
    52:54:00:04:98:db,ignore
    52:54:00:0a:e7:cc,ignore
    52:54:00:76:4f:56,ignore
    *:*:*:*:*:*,ignore
    
  Delete a node
  --------------

    [stack@leafs ~]$ openstack baremetal node delete os-ctl0
    Deleted node os-ctl0
    
    [stack@leafs ~]$ cat /var/lib/ironic-inspector/dhcp-hostsdir/*
    52:54:00:04:98:db,ignore
    52:54:00:0a:e7:cc,ignore
    52:54:00:76:4f:56,ignore
    *:*:*:*:*:*,ignore

  ^^ The node is still filtered. No-introspection active, and discovery
     disabled.

  Start introspection
  -------------------

    [stack@leafs ~]$ openstack baremetal node inspect os-leaf0-cmp0
    [stack@leafs ~]$ cat /var/lib/ironic-inspector/dhcp-hostsdir/*
    52:54:00:04:98:db
    52:54:00:0a:e7:cc,ignore
    52:54:00:76:4f:56
    *:*:*:*:*:*

  ^^ 
    * Introspection active for 98:db, so it is no longer filtered.
    * Also remove the ,ignore from 4f:56 (the deleted node) - so it can be
      re-enrolled without adding port data (mac address)

  Conclusion
  ----------

    Deleting a node, and re-enrolling will work.



======================
If we enable discovery
======================

    [root@leafs ~]# sed -i \
      's/#node_not_found_hook = <None>/node_not_found_hook = enroll/' \
      /etc/ironic-inspector/inspector.conf

    [root@leafs ~]# grep node_not_found_hook \
      /etc/ironic-inspector/inspector.conf
    node_not_found_hook = enroll

    [root@leafs ~]# systemctl restart openstack-ironic-inspector


    [stack@leafs ~]$ cat /var/lib/ironic-inspector/dhcp-hostsdir/*
    52:54:00:04:98:db,ignore
    52:54:00:0a:e7:cc,ignore
    52:54:00:76:4f:56,ignore
    *:*:*:*:*:*

  ^^ The wildcard has no ,ignore. Unknown nodes will boot introspection,
     discovered and enrolled.


  Delete a node
  --------------

    [stack@leafs ~]$ openstack baremetal node delete os-ctl0
    Deleted node os-ctl0

    [stack@leafs ~]$ cat /var/lib/ironic-inspector/dhcp-hostsdir/*
    52:54:00:04:98:db,ignore
    52:54:00:0a:e7:cc,ignore
    52:54:00:76:4f:56
    *:*:*:*:*:*

  ^^ After deleting a node the ,ignore is removed from 4f:56 (the deleted node)
     filter, so that it can be rediscovered as well.


  Conclusion
  ----------

    Rediscovery of previously deleted node will work."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-02 14:23:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

I remember a follow-up discussion with hjenas, and I think I'm good with this landing now."}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-07-04 16:12:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

After talking with Harald on IRC we discussed that this logic probably needs refactoring in the future to add a SIGHUP call to DNSmasq to ensure the configuration changes are correctly picked up.

When this happens instead of marking the mac address as blacklisted, we can simply remove the entry from the hostsdir, therefore letting it truly behave like a server that has been never been enrolled before.

Until this gets factored, I think this is a sane workaround to the problem described in the bug report, thanks Harald.'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-07-04 16:13:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Story tracking refactor added here: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002818'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-07-04 16:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

HUP support: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002819'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-07-04 19:24:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- ironic-inspector-tempest-dsvm-python3: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1449136

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-04 20:46:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-05 06:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-06 11:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-06 11:04:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> Patch Set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased

Let's see if a rebase fixes:  http://logs.openstack.org/57/566757/11/check/ironic-inspector-tempest-dsvm-python3/eb5ffac/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2018-07-05_06_55_16_298"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-06 23:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-07-07 17:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-07-09 06:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit c29c28e64b3501b53c93a370043e00af20dc4119'}]

[{'created': '2018-05-07 23:20:17.000000000', 'message': "dnsmasq PXE Filter should not whitelist deleted ports

This changes the dnsmasq PXE filter so that it clears
the content of the file in dhcp-hostdir. Replacing the
previous behaviour that only remove the ',ignore'.

Change-Id: Ib417089116dcbfb25f759708ee3cddcb88ae2111
Story: 2001979
Task: 19589
"}, {'created': '2018-05-07 23:27:48.000000000', 'message': "PXE Filter dnsmasq: Clear filter for deleted ports

This changes the dnsmasq PXE filter so that it clears
the content of the file in dhcp-hostdir. Replacing the
previous behaviour that only remove the ',ignore'.

Change-Id: Ib417089116dcbfb25f759708ee3cddcb88ae2111
Story: 2001979
Task: 19589
"}, {'created': '2018-05-08 04:36:46.000000000', 'message': 'PXE Filter dnsmasq: Clear filter for deleted ports

This changes the dnsmasq PXE filter so that it clears
the content of the file in dhcp-hostdir when a port
is for ports not longer in ironic. Replacing the
previous behaviour that would whitelist them.

We cannot simply delete the file since dnsmasq only
reads updates from new or changed files.

Change-Id: Ib417089116dcbfb25f759708ee3cddcb88ae2111
Story: 2001979
Task: 19589

'}, {'created': '2018-05-09 23:10:49.000000000', 'message': 'PXE Filter dnsmasq: manage macs not in ironic

This changes the dnsmasq PXE filter so that it keeps
macs that are no longer in ironic blacklisted unless
introspection is active or node_not_found_hook is set.

Replacing the previous behaviour that would
exclusively whitelist macs that are no longer in
ironic.

commit_message:
PXE Filter dnsmasq: manage macs not in ironic

This changes the dnsmasq PXE filter so that it keeps
macs that are no longer in ironic blacklisted unless
introspection is active or node_not_found_hook is set.

Replacing the previous behaviour that would
exclusively whitelist macs that are no longer in
ironic.

Story: 2001979
Task: 19589
Change-Id: Ib417089116dcbfb25f759708ee3cddcb88ae2111

commit_message:
Point nrpe helper at nrpe files

The glance charm has a slightly different layout compared to other
OpenStack charms so nrpe.copy_nrpe_checks() needs to be pointed
at an alternative location for the nrpe checks the charm provides.

Change-Id: I3c7ce63069379008754bcba9201a3fc9c568853d
Closes-Bug: #1779155
(cherry picked from commit 4f935e39009e145210f7b5f53b0541fc7b02b7ac)

commit_message:
Change invalid input error code to 400

Now blazar instance plugin supports only ``affinity = False`` option.
This is because we have no scheme to check if the resource capability
is exceeded when mutiple instances land on the same compute host.

Currently we raise ``500`` (internal server) error when
``affinity = True`` is set by users. However, this error should be
``400`` (bad request error) to explicitly inform users that we don't
support it so far.

This patch fixes it to return ``400`` error using the
MalformedParameter() exception. A releasenote for this fix will be
added in a following patch.

Change-Id: Iea98a4d7c448470148b58982281b5d1e9f1892b5

commit_message:
Updating required neutron version

build-openstack-sphinx-docs gate was raising an error and -1 on the
gate, due to neutron out of date version (12.0.0). This patch will bring
neutron from 13.0.0.0b1 to the newest version.

Error logs:
   ubuntu-xenial |     'router': constants.L3,
   ubuntu-xenial | AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'L3'

Please see more error logs in the following link
http://logs.openstack.org/04/557904/8/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/7a6b1da/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-03_04_00_47_083795

Change-Id: I920451a103e4c2f8384a697fb79a4ab8333f6a3c

commit_message:
[WIP] osc-included image signing

This extension adds signing functionality to image create.
Therefore a new argument --sign key-path=key-path,cert-id=cert-uuid
is added. It also adds cursive as a requirement.

Depends-On: I05a3ec582a828692693e4a38a21b77e4ee06c2d6
Change-Id: I07beb7ed5049160e0282b1bb0343d9628f9acb8a
Story: 2002128
Co-Authored-By: Markus Hentsch <markus.hentsch@secustack.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573012/

Change-Id: I71a6231832fc191633b15904246902a21f8a8130

allocated_capacity_gb.

Change-Id: Id2ceb77cd80a8fbd22243f29190717928817a7b4
Closes-Bug: #1746222
Signed-off-by: Kien Ha <kienha9922@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove report of allocated_capacity_gb from Inspur driver

Drivers should not be handling this value. Let Cinder core take care of
allocated_capacity_gb.

Change-Id: Id2ceb77cd80a8fbd22243f29190717928817a7b4
Closes-Bug: #1746222
Signed-off-by: Kien Ha <kienha9922@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 10:56:17.000000000', 'message': "Remove the unhandled_error task from baremetal.yaml

With the recent changing in workflow messaging, it is now possible that
we will get stuck in a loop of unhandled errors. Removing the unhandled_error
task will give us the sanest logs on a failure scenario.

This happens because:
1. The workflow sends an error message, which causes the messaging
   workflow to error. It ends in an error status so that the parent
   workflow doesn't need to fail itself when sending errors.
2. The unhandled_error task is triggered because the message sending
   workflow fails. GOTO 1.

The task-defult error handler was added to these workflows due to the
complexity. However, searching launchpad doesn't find any cases of it being
reported and the generic message doesn't seem particularly uesful. Therefore,
the safest option is to remove it.

Further investigation here might be useful, as a generic error handler
that is reliable could be useful. Work in Mistral to send events to a
Zaqar queue is underway and this will likely be a better solution
(clients can look for workflow failures in the events).

Closes-Bug: 1779097
Change-Id: I388c4b93de473778cc11f580a80426539aeed7e2
"}, {'created': '2018-06-28 17:01:34.000000000', 'message': "Remove the unhandled_error task from baremetal.yaml

Change-Id: I388c4b93de473778cc11f580a80426539aeed7e2
"}, {'created': '2018-06-28 17:01:39.000000000', 'message': "Remove the unhandled_error task from baremetal.yaml

commit_message:
Remove the unhandled_error task from baremetal.yaml

With the recent changing in workflow messaging, it is now possible that
we will get stuck in a loop of unhandled errors. Removing the unhandled_error
task will give us the sanest logs on a failure scenario.

This happens because:
1. The workflow sends an error message, which causes the messaging
   workflow to error. It ends in an error status so that the parent
   workflow doesn't need to fail itself when sending errors.
2. The unhandled_error task is triggered because the message sending
   workflow fails. GOTO 1.

The task-defult error handler was added to these workflows due to the
complexity. However, searching launchpad doesn't find any cases of it being
reported and the generic message doesn't seem particularly uesful. Therefore,
the safest option is to remove it.

Further investigation here might be useful, as a generic error handler
that is reliable could be useful. Work in Mistral to send events to a
Zaqar queue is underway and this will likely be a better solution
(clients can look for workflow failures in the events).

Closes-Bug: 1779097
Depends-On: I5f574923bb3f38b8f71a002e643bf89b52069adc
Change-Id: I388c4b93de473778cc11f580a80426539aeed7e2

than do that.

commit_message:
use db utils from lib

The APIs our consumers are using from neutron.db_utils were rehomed into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540161/ and will be
consumed in neutron with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565593

This patch switches the applicable imports over to neutron-lib.
It also bumps neutron-lib up to 1.16.0.
A shim is added to determine which db utils to patch due to bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tricircle/+bug/1776922

Change-Id: If41f998453d2c6492ceebd2985e457b57e21b0f1

commit_message:
Add cloud to warning about domain related config

When this warning fires you get a bunch of

 Ignoring domain related config project_domain_name because identity API version is 2.0
 Ignoring domain related config user_domain_name because identity API version is 2.0

in the output, but no clue as to what cloud was actually causing the
problem to help you debug.  This is a bit annoying if you have many
different clouds setup in your configuration.  Add the name of the
cloud to the message.

Change-Id: Id2b5133f583f7071745e02001eaeaa3dcee211ba

The hiera check for bootstrap node was using 'manila-share'

"}]
commit_message:
Fix bootstrap_host_exec check for manila_share

The hiera check for bootstrap node was using 'manila-share'
for service name, which returns nil.  Changing the service
name to 'manila_share', the hiera lookup for
'manila_share_short_bootstrap_node_name' succeeds.

Change-Id: Id3c001f8f0ee9dc156f22a027f66516d6812f51a

[{'created': '2018-05-14 20:10:33.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] improve speed of lbaas-loadbalancer-list

WORK IN PROGRESS, DO NOT MERGE

from 50.932s to 39.630s

Change-Id: I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e
'}, {'created': '2018-05-25 13:29:25.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Improve speed of lbaas-loadbalancer-list

WORK IN PROGRESS, DO NOT MERGE

from 50.932s to 2.335s

Change-Id: I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e
'}, {'created': '2018-05-25 16:32:15.000000000', 'message': 'Improve speed of loading LBs from BD

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from a few get_loabalancer calls, instead more directly
transforming from the SQLAlchemy model to the required api dictionary
format. Thus this entierly skips loading a few relations that walking
the intermediary object model triggered without the target output
needing them.

Use eager loading where the api dictionary representation is needed, as
the relations needed for it are always the same.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs this improved the speed of a cli
call of lbaas-loadbalancer-list from 50.932s to 2.335s.

Change-Id: I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e
'}, {'created': '2018-05-29 15:09:06.000000000', 'message': 'Improve speed of loading LBs from DB

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from get_loabalancers, instead more directly transforming
from the SQLAlchemy model to the required api dictionary format. Thus
this entierly skips loading a few relations that walking the
intermediary object model triggered without the target output needing
them.

the relations needed for it are always the same.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs this improved the speed of a cli
call of lbaas-loadbalancer-list from 50.932s to 2.335s.

Story: 2001962
Change-Id: I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e
'}, {'created': '2018-06-12 12:44:39.000000000', 'message': 'Improve speed of listing from DB

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from get_loabalancers, get_pools and, get_listeners.
Instead it more directly transforms from the SQLAlchemy model to the
required api dictionary format. Thus this entierly skips loading a few
relations that walking the intermediary object model triggered without
the target output needing them.

Use eager loading specified at query time where the api dictionary
representation is needed, as the relations needed for it are always the
same.

Removes eager loading from the model of the relations
L7Policy[rules]->L7Rule[policy] and
Listener[l7_policies]->L7Policy[listener] and
Listener[default_pool]->PoolV2[listeners].

These relations are sometimes unncessarily loaded and then never used.
E.g. the API dictionary format for loadbalancers does include policies
but not rules; does include listeners but not any L7Policy.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs this improved the speed of a cli
call of lbaas-loadbalancer-list from 50.932s to 2.335s. It similarly
improved lbaas-pool-list and lbaas-listener-list.

This continues what I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb started.

commit_message:
Improve speed of listing from DB

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from get_loabalancers, get_pools, get_listeners,
get_healthmonitors, get_l7policies, get_l7policy_rules,
get_pool_members.
Instead it more directly transforms from the SQLAlchemy model to the
required api dictionary format. Thus this entierly skips loading a few
relations that walking the intermediary object model triggered without
the target output needing them.

Use eager loading specified at query time where the api dictionary
representation is needed, as the relations needed for it are always the
same.

Removes eager loading from the model of the relations
L7Policy[rules]->L7Rule[policy] and
Listener[l7_policies]->L7Policy[listener] and
Listener[default_pool]->PoolV2[listeners].

These relations are sometimes unncessarily loaded and then never used.
E.g. the API dictionary format for loadbalancers does include policies
but not rules; does include listeners but not any L7Policy.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs this improved the speed of a cli
call of lbaas-loadbalancer-list from 50.932s to 2.335s. It similarly
improved lbaas-pool-list and lbaas-listener-list,
lbaas-healthmonitor-list, lbaas-l7policy-list, lbaas-l7rule-list,
lbaas-member-list.

This continues what I9d67f0966561baaefb50ae97b943ff6593e194eb started.

Story: 2001962
Change-Id: I32328c5206b9cd6fb8d8764c079f22b6ea8bfa9e

commit_message:
Drop mox3 from requirements

Apart of the community wide goal for Rocky.

Also update requirements to pass the gate.

Change-Id: I645f2fa76bc7eefa8ffe58791cc9f5a9668169dc
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
INFINIDAT: change create_child to create_snapshot

create_child method was deprecated in favor of create_snapshot
in infinisdk package. This is an internal change and should have
no customer impact.

Change-Id: I47a29c2223c05e89da4a528350d23a2201751182

commit_message:
Enable Python hash seed randomization in tests

Unit tests should run with hash seed randomization
on, to ensure code is not introduced that relies on
ordered access of dicts, sets, etc.

Python 3.3 enables this at runtime by default.

Change-Id: Ia9831b9c8d91fc7de82a1d215b00b498d01d562f

would try to fetch features from ODL. However, this is not needed since
there is a configuration key that can be used to override the fetch
behavior and instead force which features are enabled.

uses the configuration key instead.

commit_message:
Remove mock for odl_features.init()

It is currently mocked because by the justification that calling it
would try to fetch features from ODL. However, this is not needed since
there is a configuration key that can be used to override the fetch
behavior and instead force which features are enabled.

This patch removes the unnecesary and counter-intuitive mock, and it
uses the configuration key instead.

Change-Id: I0b03fc3708c2026afa066ef1836ada5cc94b672d

port_profile as introduced in patch 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499575/
currently the capabilities interpreted as string which is no big deal
in OVS currently, but in OpenDaylight its is networking-odl epect
switchdev to be inside list.

commit_message:
fix port_profile

port_profile as introduced in patch 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499575/
currently the capabilities interpreted as string which is no big deal
in OVS currently, but in OpenDaylight its is networking-odl epect
switchdev to be inside list.

[network]
port_profile = capabilities:[switchdev]

result:
{'capabilities':'[switchdev]'}

With patch:
{'capabilities': ['switchdev']} 

Change-Id: I07f79480f77ccde8f742e2eab8c61d40b6d43236

commit_message:
Fixes for the CI

This is a combination of two commits:

Commit #1: Add missing devstack function

The change [1] added an expectation of the function `conductor_conf` to
exist. In the cases of functional/fullstack testing this function
does not exist, thus breaking the devstack flow.

This patch adds a no-op function to functional/fullstack testing to
avoid this issue.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576249/

Commit #2: Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [2] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.

[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ic5622ce52b7ed595c7bd0a1b9fcbaa1c6e9f781d
Co-Authored-By: shubhendu <shubhendu.poothia@nectechnologies.in>

Change-Id: I3f91833c778fcee373dcdfb89ae9e9bbf3dd7a59

I'm very sorry for my misoperation."}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-02-15 17:20:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-02-15 17:50:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow Code-Review-2

Sorry - lets wait on this, need to do some additional testing.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-02-15 19:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So I actually thing this will break the dashboard. The problem is that while tables.DeleteAction does indeed have self.name set. The problem is that DeleteAction inherits from BatchAction, and not the other-way around.

So neither DeleteDomain or BatchDeleteRecord while have name set automatically, only DeleteRecord.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-02-15 19:31:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-05-07 04:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Gonna block this one, as I believe this patch breaks designate-dashboard.

Erik, you are correct. DeleteDomain class inherits not DeleteAction but BatchAction, so 'name' attribute cannot be dropped. the author proposed similar patches to several repositories and I am afraid he did not check which parent class is used carefully."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-06-03 00:10:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Remove the unused attribute

DeleteInstance action inherits from tables.DeleteAction.
The parent class has the attribute 'name = "delete"' So
remove the unused attribute.

Change-Id: I340429c0b102412f901996b576e71bb4c8f35cea

commit_message:
Keystone no longer uses paste-ini

With the move to flask, Keystone does not utilize paste-ini. This
patchset removes the paste-ini support from devstack for Keystone.

Change-Id: I8dd629937c9178660992fd648175dbef80ffa3c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 13:47:33.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce restart_bundle containers to detect config changes and restart pacemaker resources

During the containerization work we regressed on the restart of
pacemaker resources when a config change for the service was detected.
In baremetal we used to do the following:
1) If a puppet config change was detect we'd touch a file with the
   service name under /var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts/<service>
2) A post deployment bash script (extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_resource_restart.sh)
   would test for the service file's existence and restart the pcs service via
   'pcs resource restart --wait=600 service' on the bootstrap node.

With this patchset we make use of paunch's ability do detect if a config
hash change happened to respawn a temporary container (called
<service>_restart_bundle) which will simply always restart the pacemaker
service from the bootstrap node whenever invoked, but only if the pcmk
resource already exists. For this reason we add config_volume and bind
mount it inside the container, so that the TRIPLEO_CONFIG_HASH env
variable gets generated for these *_restart_bundle containers.

We tested this change as follows:
A) Deployed an HA overcloud with this change and observed that pcmk resources
   were not restarted needlessly during initial deploy
B) Rerun the exact same overcloud deploy with no changes, observed that
   no spurious restarts would take place
C) Added an env file to trigger the of config of haproxy[1], redeployed and observed that it restarted
   haproxy only:
   Jun 06 16:22:37 overcloud-controller-0 dockerd-current[15272]: haproxy-bundle restart invoked
D) Added a trigger [2] for mysql config change, redeployed and observed restart:
   Jun 06 16:40:52 overcloud-controller-0 dockerd-current[15272]: galera-bundle restart invoked
E) Added a trigger [3] for a rabbitmq config change, redeployed and observed restart:
   Jun 06 17:03:41 overcloud-controller-0 dockerd-current[15272]: rabbitmq-bundle restart invoked
F) Added a trigger [4] for a redis config change, redeployed and observed restart:
   Jun 07 08:42:54 overcloud-controller-0 dockerd-current[15272]: redis-bundle restart invoked
G) Rerun a deploy with no changes and observed that no spurious restarts
   were triggered

[1] haproxy config change trigger:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_globals_override:
      'maxconn': 1111

[2] mysql config change trigger:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    mysql_max_connections: 1111

[3] rabbitmq config change trigger (default partition handling is 'ignore'):
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    rabbitmq_config_variables:
      cluster_partition_handling: 'pause_minority'
      queue_master_locator: '<<"min-masters">>'
      loopback_users: '[]'

[4] redis config change trigger:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    redis::tcp_backlog: 666
    redis::params::tcp_backlog: 666

Change-Id: I62870c055097569ceab2ff67cf0fe63122277c5b
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1775196
(cherry picked from commit a6389da22d43fa61d4db16b676b23c3a4c468dfd)

commit_message:
Introduce restart_bundle containers to detect config changes and restart pacemaker resources

During the containerization work we regressed on the restart of
pacemaker resources when a config change for the service was detected.
In baremetal we used to do the following:
1) If a puppet config change was detect we'd touch a file with the
   service name under /var/lib/tripleo/pacemaker-restarts/<service>
2) A post deployment bash script (extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_resource_restart.sh)
   would test for the service file's existence and restart the pcs service via
   'pcs resource restart --wait=600 service' on the bootstrap node.

With this patchset we make use of paunch's ability do detect if a config
hash change happened to respawn a temporary container (called
<service>_restart_bundle) which will simply always restart the pacemaker
service from the bootstrap node whenever invoked, but only if the pcmk
resource already exists. For this reason we add config_volume and bind
mount it inside the container, so that the TRIPLEO_CONFIG_HASH env
variable gets generated for these *_restart_bundle containers.

We tested this change as follows:
A) Deployed an HA overcloud with this change and observed that pcmk resources
   were not restarted needlessly during initial deploy
B) Rerun the exact same overcloud deploy with no changes, observed that
   no spurious restarts would take place
C) Added an env file to trigger the of config of haproxy[1], redeployed and observed that it restarted
   haproxy only:
   Jun 06 16:22:37 overcloud-controller-0 dockerd-current[15272]: haproxy-bundle restart invoked
D) Added a trigger [2] for mysql config change, redeployed and observed restart:
   Jun 06 16:40:52 overcloud-controller-0 dockerd-current[15272]: galera-bundle restart invoked
E) Added a trigger [3] for a rabbitmq config change, redeployed and observed restart:
   Jun 06 17:03:41 overcloud-controller-0 dockerd-current[15272]: rabbitmq-bundle restart invoked
F) Added a trigger [4] for a redis config change, redeployed and observed restart:
   Jun 07 08:42:54 overcloud-controller-0 dockerd-current[15272]: redis-bundle restart invoked
G) Rerun a deploy with no changes and observed that no spurious restarts
   were triggered

[1] haproxy config change trigger:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_globals_override:
      'maxconn': 1111

[2] mysql config change trigger:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    mysql_max_connections: 1111

[3] rabbitmq config change trigger (default partition handling is 'ignore'):
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    rabbitmq_config_variables:
      cluster_partition_handling: 'pause_minority'
      queue_master_locator: '<<"min-masters">>'
      loopback_users: '[]'

[4] redis config change trigger:
parameter_defaults:
  ExtraConfig:
    redis::tcp_backlog: 666
    redis::params::tcp_backlog: 666

Change-Id: I62870c055097569ceab2ff67cf0fe63122277c5b
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1775196
(cherry picked from commit a6389da22d43fa61d4db16b676b23c3a4c468dfd)

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

Removed because they seem to have been removed from the last update:
 - +networkx===2.1
 - +google-auth===1.5.0
 - +eventlet===0.22.1
 - +google-api-python-client===1.7.3

And the following because we don't want .post releases:

Before we stored flavors in instance_extra, certain fields, defined
in nova.compute.flavors.system_metadata_flavor_props, were stored
in the instance.system_metadata for the embedded instance.flavor.
The "disabled" field wasn't one of those keys, however, so really
old instances that had their embedded flavor converted to the

commit_message:
Default embedded instance.flavor.disabled attribute

Before we stored flavors in instance_extra, certain fields, defined
in nova.compute.flavors.system_metadata_flavor_props, were stored
in the instance.system_metadata for the embedded instance.flavor.
The "disabled" field wasn't one of those keys, however, so really
old instances that had their embedded flavor converted to the
serialized instance_extra form won't have the disabled attribute
set and we need to default those here so callers, like the
versioned notfication FlavorPayload, don't explode trying to load
instance.flavor.disabled.

Change-Id: I72f8c11b8b2df1416dec8e2d9250eac0693a30e9
Closes-Bug: #1739325
(cherry picked from commit 8df21c1e5fc46f2774a7653e1c9a4c2ac0b5dbfd)

commit_message:
add mtu to libvirt xml for ethernet and bridge types

Where libvirt is creating the tap device e.g: OVS bridge
(hybrid=False). os-vif will just ensure that the OVS bridge exists. We
want libvirt to create the tap, configure the MTU and then plug the
tap into the right bridge.

- This change adds the mtu element to libvirt guest
  interface xml for vifs of type ethernet and bridge.
- This change adds a libvirt version check
  to enable setting the interface mtu on hosts with
  libvirt 3.3.0+

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py

NOTE(lyarwood): This conflict is due to the removal of IVS plug/unplug
via dIcf948f6ee1c0da2327fb5eac61fec6e89ac30531 during Rocky, resulting
in the eventual master change having to reintroduce get_config_bridge
that is already present in stable/queens.

Change-Id: Iecc265fb25e88fa00a66f1fd38e215cad53e7669
Partial-bug: #1747496
(cherry picked from commit f02b3800051234ecc14f3117d5987b1a8ef75877)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-03 13:01:28.000000000', 'message': "Use ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa in tree

ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa is
defined in the ironic repo but nova uses it because it's defined
in the project-config repo with it's own irrelevant-files list.
Due to a recent change in zuul [1], the definition from project-config
overrides the irrelevant-files from the job definition in ironic and
results in us running this job on things like docs-only changes in
nova, which is not awesome.

This change moves the job usage in-tree from project-config and updates
the irrelevant-files list to match nova-dsvm-base.

Since project-config is branchless, we'll have to backport this in-tree
change to nova's stable branches to continue running this job on nova
stable branches once the override is removed from project-config.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131304.html

Change-Id: I9435fe84c8dc8a6f35ffb195ddbf71ca34edb242
Closes-Bug: #1776981
(cherry picked from commit 17b3bae64ca7aa4c1a6d296860cce6c0bfbb38a1)
"}]
commit_message:
Use ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa in tree

ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa is
defined in the ironic repo but nova uses it because it's defined
in the project-config repo with it's own irrelevant-files list.
Due to a recent change in zuul [1], the definition from project-config
overrides the irrelevant-files from the job definition in ironic and
results in us running this job on things like docs-only changes in
nova, which is not awesome.

This change moves the job usage in-tree from project-config and updates
the irrelevant-files list to match nova-dsvm-base.

Since project-config is branchless, we'll have to backport this in-tree
change to nova's stable branches to continue running this job on nova
stable branches once the override is removed from project-config.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131304.html

Change-Id: I9435fe84c8dc8a6f35ffb195ddbf71ca34edb242
Closes-Bug: #1776981
(cherry picked from commit 17b3bae64ca7aa4c1a6d296860cce6c0bfbb38a1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 13:39:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix regression when listing build_requests with marker and ip filter

Change Ic02206e887e3fea7752d615bbed680510c482097 attempted
to optimize the GET /servers flow by skipping filtering on
build requests if the ip or ip6 filters were used, since
servers that are not yet scheduled (build requests) can't have
ips. However, if a marker is provided and the marker is in the
build_requests table, we fail to look there and then check the
cells for the marker, which won't exist and result in a 400
MarkerNotFound error.

This fixes the issue by *not* skipping build requests if there
is a marker specified. A functional test is added which will
show the 400 MarkerNotFound error if the code fix is removed.

Change-Id: Ibdd157d06252c3c0219539ec798c8d9d3a8ae26f
Closes-Bug: #1777458
(cherry picked from commit 8cea14abf30c40da4ce5ffcfb4fb37dd79083255)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix regression when listing build_requests with marker and ip filter

Change Ic02206e887e3fea7752d615bbed680510c482097 attempted
to optimize the GET /servers flow by skipping filtering on
build requests if the ip or ip6 filters were used, since
servers that are not yet scheduled (build requests) can't have
ips. However, if a marker is provided and the marker is in the
build_requests table, we fail to look there and then check the
cells for the marker, which won't exist and result in a 400
MarkerNotFound error.

This fixes the issue by *not* skipping build requests if there
is a marker specified. A functional test is added which will
show the 400 MarkerNotFound error if the code fix is removed.

Change-Id: Ibdd157d06252c3c0219539ec798c8d9d3a8ae26f
Closes-Bug: #1777458
(cherry picked from commit 8cea14abf30c40da4ce5ffcfb4fb37dd79083255)

commit_message:
Make nova service-list use scatter-gather routine

This patch makes nova service-list use the scatter-gather routine
so that if a cell is down, at least the services from other cells
are listed by ignoring the down cell instead of the whole command
failing with an API exception as is the current situation. Also
making this query parallel for all cells is more efficient.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/569112/

Change-Id: I90b488102eb265d971cade29892279a22d3b5273
Closes-Bug: #1726310
(cherry picked from commit 64e76de43dc55e584c100005fa60da50dd06d352)

[{'created': '2018-06-25 09:11:30.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Log breadcrumb for known encryption bug

The initial implementation of native LUKS support within Libvirt
introduced a small issue when using a passphrase that is a multiple of
16 bytes in size. This is documented in the following bug and associated
patch posted to the Libvirt development list:

Unable to use LUKS passphrase that is exactly 16 bytes long
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1447297

[libvirt] [PATCH] Fix padding of encrypted data
https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2017-May/msg00030.html

This change introduces a known issue release note and logs an additional
breadcrumb when we appear to hit this with pointers to the above.

Closes-Bug: #1778044
Change-Id: Id346bce6e47431988cce7001abcf29a9faf2936a
(cherry picked from commit 78891c2305bff6e16706339a9c5eca99a84e409c)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Log breadcrumb for known encryption bug

The initial implementation of native LUKS support within Libvirt
introduced a small issue when using a passphrase that is a multiple of
16 bytes in size. This is documented in the following bug and associated
patch posted to the Libvirt development list:

Unable to use LUKS passphrase that is exactly 16 bytes long
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1447297

[libvirt] [PATCH] Fix padding of encrypted data
https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2017-May/msg00030.html

This change introduces a known issue release note and logs an additional
breadcrumb when we appear to hit this with pointers to the above.

Closes-Bug: #1778044
Change-Id: Id346bce6e47431988cce7001abcf29a9faf2936a
(cherry picked from commit 78891c2305bff6e16706339a9c5eca99a84e409c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 00:16:33.000000000', 'message': 'Handle network-changed event for a specific port

It turns out that when Neutron sends the "network-changed"
event it has a port in scope and can provide the port ID.

Older versions of Neutron wouldn't send this, but if it's
provided, we can try to optimize the network info cache
refresh and scope it to just that single port, rather than
build the entire cache all over again when the other ports
in the cache may not have changed at all since the last
time the cache was refreshed.

This can be especially beneficial for instances with a
relatively large number of ports which are being migrated.

Depends-On: Ifdaef05208d09ddd9587fed6214cf388e5265ba4

Change-Id: I023b5b1ccb248e68189f62ba0ff75d41093c1f60
Partial-Bug: #1691602
(cherry picked from commit 537f480927293755bd6365068c1abd0c80951bad)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle network-changed event for a specific port

It turns out that when Neutron sends the "network-changed"
event it has a port in scope and can provide the port ID.

Older versions of Neutron wouldn't send this, but if it's
provided, we can try to optimize the network info cache
refresh and scope it to just that single port, rather than
build the entire cache all over again when the other ports
in the cache may not have changed at all since the last
time the cache was refreshed.

This can be especially beneficial for instances with a
relatively large number of ports which are being migrated.

Depends-On: Ifdaef05208d09ddd9587fed6214cf388e5265ba4

Change-Id: I023b5b1ccb248e68189f62ba0ff75d41093c1f60
Partial-Bug: #1691602
(cherry picked from commit 537f480927293755bd6365068c1abd0c80951bad)

commit_message:
Set configure_qemu to true to get qemu port range applied

With https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561784 we change the default
migration port range to '61152-61215'.
nova::migration::qemu::configure_qemu needs to be set to true that
the config gets applied via puppet-nova.

Change-Id: Iad4b392c9fe7426f2ce10a02fadd8b1aeee34ef6
Closes-bug: 1779820
Depends-On: Idadfc7b3507977f1385e846a48a734ed0e5f0a32
(cherry picked from commit 547552fc7b6730f7d0670c5b0d76f63e5372f8c7)

commit_message:
Make sure we apply qemu config changes

With the change in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561784/3 we need to
make sure that the new port range get applied to the the qemu.conf file.
This change includes ::nova::migration::qemu to
::tripleo::profile::base::nova::libvirt

commit_message:
Make sure we apply qemu config changes

With the change in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561784/3 we need to
make sure that the new port range get applied to the the qemu.conf file.
This change includes ::nova::migration::qemu to
::tripleo::profile::base::nova::libvirt

Change-Id: Idadfc7b3507977f1385e846a48a734ed0e5f0a32
Closes-bug: 1779820
(cherry picked from commit ed16fdc55d76fe8f7fdf7c9ca3bd9acd66cbc3af)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 17:55:46.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Change-Id: I155b5036dd98f80a0d31d8bb691beae147a97bc3

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Change-Id: I155b5036dd98f80a0d31d8bb691beae147a97bc3

[{'created': '2018-07-02 10:23:58.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. As there are no required packages left, the task to install them is
also removed.

The openstack_openrc role is now executed once on the designated host, so
it is no longer necessary as a meta-dependency for the role.

Ceilometer no longer has an API service, so the service setup task for it is
removed as it is unnecessary.

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. As there are no required packages left, the task to install them is
also removed.

The openstack_openrc role is now executed once on the designated host, so
it is no longer necessary as a meta-dependency for the role.

Ceilometer no longer has an API service, so the service setup task for it is
removed as it is unnecessary, along with the related variables which are no
longer used.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Change-Id: I4072acc1770432526a8bc26ebb5833b6fdd61f0a

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Change-Id: I20186fd3bb4a3fade91e14f6360232454de9c989

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Change-Id: Ib46638d1cb35e677ecfe789a32bb69a024042d6f

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Change-Id: I4131312eea8c743e7803ccc622b7642c6082a4c8

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Change-Id: Ie32143ba23b964f9ceda98f00ff9cfa1c7a131d6

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The openstack_openrc role is now executed once on the designated host, so
it is no longer necessary to execute it using include_role here.

The zun_requires_pip_packages variable is not used and is therefore removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579233
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579959
Change-Id: I7108b43109136aac46bc87a0c59827a202f87be8

commit_message:
Neutron: check that local ip address is populated on agent startup

This PS updates the agent init container scripts to ensure that the
local IP address is populated on agent startup.

Change-Id: Ib5857d9dc82b1138a1b5f496ebe46dc1e3f221e7
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Remove blockdev from volume.filters

Remove the 'blockdev' command from the volume.filters since
the block-device driver has been deprecated since 2016.

Change-Id: Ifb554898287b139d6ec07f73b012509b7d59c005
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

'}, {'created': '2018-05-30 09:12:32.000000000', 'message': 'Check pep8 without ignoring D000

Currently, pep8 ignores D000 check because of error:
"D000 Cannot analyze code. Pygments package not found."

Pygments is supported from:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568729/

This patch also changed code-block type from "none" to "ini"

Change-Id: I05d1d41160ad86589308912ff81c4294983069ff

commit_message:
Check pep8 without ignoring D000

Currently, pep8 ignores D000 check because of error:
"D000 Cannot analyze code. Pygments package not found."

Pygments is supported from:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568729/

This patch also changed code-block type from "none" to "ini"
as D000 check does not allow the "none" type.

Change-Id: I05d1d41160ad86589308912ff81c4294983069ff

commit_message:
add default overcloud-prep tags

Users may not know about which tags to use or not use.
Users may also not be running in a step by step method.
Allow users three basic options.

1. machine prep and undercloud
2. machine prep, undercloud, and overcloud prep
3. all steps

Resolves-Bug: #1737602

commit_message:
Specifies the storage backend to boot instance

When there are multiple storage backends in the environment,
we should specify the storage backend to start the instance
on the specified storage backend. Here, the requirements for
specifying the backend creation instance are implemented.

bp: boot-instance-specific-storage-backend

Change-Id: Icc301230fe7c8e3ebbbcc7f4a807e562db7f93e3

commit_message:
Complete migration cleanup of resources

The changes in this commit make use of neutron-netns-cleanup within
the kolla containers used by tripleo to cleanup the neutron
resources as those are found in each host.

Also neutron security group filtering rules inserted in iptables
are removed.

Change-Id: I43fb721d9b73ff09e981f3c2555efa8aca067cf9

Updates the inventory, config-download and deployments.yaml tasks file
to force using lowercase hostnames everywhere. Hostnames should be
treated as case insensitive.

	tripleo_common/templates/deployments.yaml

'}]
commit_message:
Force lowercase hostnames

Updates the inventory, config-download and deployments.yaml tasks file
to force using lowercase hostnames everywhere. Hostnames should be
treated as case insensitive.

Conflicts:
	tripleo_common/inventory.py
	tripleo_common/templates/deployments.yaml

Change-Id: If9365f53c215c656cc558f07fd6651dd4a471fbf
Closes-Bug: #1777660
(cherry picked from commit acd1bed60752efbe1d40a80583f0bb696b63fe07)

commit_message:
Properly pass id attribute to EnvironmentCheckBox input

controlId prop is not passed down to CheckBox component by React Bootstrap,
this change removes use of controlId and passes the id to CheckBox component
as part of other props

Task: 22508
Story: 2002685
Change-Id: I9e18ccd7a7b50b0429a0a1837e22b897daaba79d

commit_message:
Enable secure TUNNELLED mode for NFS

This is the follow up patch for change
Ie4fe217bd119b638f42c682d21572547f02f17b2 which allows
configuring NFS backend for Nova.

To provide enhanced security improvement for migration, this
change enables TUNNELLED mode for migration, in case of
NFS shared storage.

Depends-On: Ie4fe217bd119b638f42c682d21572547f02f17b2

Change-Id: Id0cfc945814e6aa5a5c85643514cf206f42e50f4
Implements: bp tripleo-nova-nfs
(cherry picked from commit db1976c0c7252da9ba142fd141a974c9df8870f3)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ife7b0078c67df55b4b5d5b3d27f4228907a5531b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-07 16:45:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-07 19:47:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm, looks like errors due to changes in dict ordering with python3, but that shouldn't have changed with this patch."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-07 20:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Actually, this looks like a side effect from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/502074/

We may need to update the assert checks for these to handle variable ordering. Unless you know of a better way to handle this.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-07 21:37:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Actually, this looks like a side effect from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/502074/
 > 
 > We may need to update the assert checks for these to handle
 > variable ordering. Unless you know of a better way to handle this.

A quick search doesn't turn up a way to change the hash seed behavior at runtime once it has been initialized.

That test appears to be trying to validate that the schema is being written to a file after being serialized. That's 2 things, so, we could split the test into a few separate tests and avoid depending on the serialized representation.

Splitting the tests will require changing the library code so that the write can be mocked. That means moving lines 462-463 into their own method or function. The arguments should be the filename and the not-yet-serialized schema data. That method can then be mocked and we can test that it tries to write to a file when it is called (this is test 1).

The logic within _cache_schemas() that builds the list of schema data can also then be extracted into its own method, and we can test that it produces the expected sequence of filenames and schema data. If we turn it into a generator function we can still loop over its output easily as well, so that _cache_schemas() will be simpler when the change is done (the sequence test is test 2).

Finally, we can loop over the schema data we are given from the new generator and test that it can be serialized to JSON at all, without checking what the result is other than to verify that it is not empty (this is test 3). This lets us know that we don't have something in the schema that can't be represented as JSON (a socket or file handle or something) but the test won't care what the representation is because that would be testing the JSON serializer, which is not part of glance client.

It's possible there is a shorter way to do that, and that someone more familiar with the code would be able to get creative with mocks or ordered dicts or something like that."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-07 21:39:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

 > this.
 > 
 > A quick search doesn't turn up a way to change the hash seed
 > behavior at runtime once it has been initialized.
 > 
 > That test appears to be trying to validate that the schema is being
 > written to a file after being serialized. That's 2 things, so, we
 > could split the test into a few separate tests and avoid depending
 > on the serialized representation.
 > 
 > Splitting the tests will require changing the library code so that
 > the write can be mocked. That means moving lines 462-463 into their
 > own method or function. The arguments should be the filename and
 > the not-yet-serialized schema data. That method can then be mocked
 > and we can test that it tries to write to a file when it is called
 > (this is test 1).
 > 
 > The logic within _cache_schemas() that builds the list of schema
 > data can also then be extracted into its own method, and we can
 > test that it produces the expected sequence of filenames and schema
 > data. If we turn it into a generator function we can still loop
 > over its output easily as well, so that _cache_schemas() will be
 > simpler when the change is done (the sequence test is test 2).
 > 
 > Finally, we can loop over the schema data we are given from the new
 > generator and test that it can be serialized to JSON at all,
 > without checking what the result is other than to verify that it is
 > not empty (this is test 3). This lets us know that we don't have
 > something in the schema that can't be represented as JSON (a socket
 > or file handle or something) but the test won't care what the
 > representation is because that would be testing the JSON
 > serializer, which is not part of glance client.
 > 
 > It's possible there is a shorter way to do that, and that someone
 > more familiar with the code would be able to get creative with
 > mocks or ordered dicts or something like that.

Oh, alternatively we could deserialize the argument to the mock call and compare that against the raw data structure instead of comparing the strings. I don't know how hard it is to get the data out of a mock call like that."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-07 21:51:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-07 21:52:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm trying that in the new parent patch that I rebased this one on top of."}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-06-08 06:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-08 14:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-11 08:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-06-23 02:07:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8a41be18dac0fc3199ee5fa691a4ab48fae66849
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Keystone: it enables keystone notificaitons

This patch sets the notifier driver to messagingv2 so all
messages sent to RabbitMQ using the 2.0 format.

For info:
Auth notificaitons are supressed by default, to enable it
uncomment the following parameter:
conf:
  DEFAULT:
    notification_opt_out: ""

Change-Id: I652fc34a229612dcb8b96c8722b8c6ac1c8aba3e
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Khanbikov <rk760n@att.com>

commit_message:
RabbitMQ: It adds HA and ttl policy for notificaitons queues

This patchset introduces mirroring "notificaitons.*" queues messages across
rmq cluster nodes and add ttl expiration time for messages, utilizing
rabbitmq helm-toolkit

the configuration example:

rabbitmq:
  policies:
    - name: "test"
      vhost: "nova"
      definition: ".*"
      definition:
        ha-mode: all
  ...

equals:
 rabbitmqctl set_policies -p nova test ".*" "{"ha-mode":"all"}"
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Khanbikov <rk760n@att.com>

Change-Id: I61215de07cfaeb9d896126ef9abc94fcc9e429b9
Depends-On: I85240a50fb64a4d74454768034fe3bdcf25f3019

(1 comment)

I will add the unit test once the approach is finalised.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-10-25 19:54:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

So, this isn't exactly what I had in mind. It is probably more efficient than what I was thinking, but it's mixing a lot of layers together, IMHO.

Could we return a list of uuids to the caller and then let the caller go nuke the mappings?

Also, I wonder if it might be useful to make the archiver just list uuids from shadow_instances and make sure no mappings exist for those uuids? That would let us clean things up later after a failed run, for example. It's not very efficient if you don't clean you shadow tables frequently, but.. I wonder if it would be simpler?"}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2017-11-02 13:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26936, 'date': '2017-11-02 13:50:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

Thank you for the review.

 > (4 comments)
 > 
 > So, this isn't exactly what I had in mind. It is probably more
 > efficient than what I was thinking, but it's mixing a lot of layers
 > together, IMHO.
 > 
 > Could we return a list of uuids to the caller and then let the
 > caller go nuke the mappings?

I have now done it this way.

 > 
 > Also, I wonder if it might be useful to make the archiver just list
 > uuids from shadow_instances and make sure no mappings exist for
 > those uuids? That would let us clean things up later after a failed
 > run, for example. It's not very efficient if you don't clean you

commit_message:
cleanup mapping/reqspec after archive instance

This patch aims at deleting the records of the archived instances from
the instance_mappings and request_specs tables in the API database
immediately following their archival from instances to shadow_instances
table. So upon running the 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' command
the records of the archived instances will be automatically removed from
the instance_mappings and request_specs tables as well. A warning has
also been added to fix the issue of 'nova-manage verify_instance'
returning a valid instance mapping even after the instance is deleted.

The patch also adds InstanceMappingList.destory_bulk() and
RequestSpec.destroy_bulk() methods for ease of bulk deletion of records.

Change-Id: I483701a55576c245d091ff086b32081b392f746e
Closes-Bug: #1724621
Closes-Bug: #1678056

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-06 16:39:05.000000000', 'message': "Do not access the connection's socket during error callback

The _get_connection_info() method attempts to gather debug information
from the connection, and will reach into the amqp channel to get the
local (client's) TCP port number via the 'sock' property.

If _get_connection_info() is called from autoretry's on_error handler
the 'sock' property notices that the transport is not set and attempts
to re-connect.  amqp has deprecated this reconnect behavior, and in
any case the client's socket is irrelevant since the connection may
not be valid at this point.

Closes-Bug: #1745166
Change-Id: I3c42f8463605927f6f94d6c3a7f05e584476abc1
"}]
commit_message:
Do not access the connection's socket during error callback

The _get_connection_info() method attempts to gather debug information
from the connection, and will reach into the amqp channel to get the
local (client's) TCP port number via the 'sock' property.

If _get_connection_info() is called from autoretry's on_error handler
the 'sock' property notices that the transport is not set and attempts
to re-connect.  amqp has deprecated this reconnect behavior, and in
any case the client's socket is irrelevant since the connection may
not be valid at this point.

Closes-Bug: #1745166
Change-Id: I3c42f8463605927f6f94d6c3a7f05e584476abc1

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia8a5b5d84231a0f0eee3d9e24ed2d6e778548ca2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix doc creation for tempest

* configure and run tempest in combined
into one script.
* configure tempest needs the title tag
for the doc to be created correctly.

title
=====

Change-Id: I1b005a3d1dfa7971cbe4bab1a18764eaaa84114d
